				<div class="campl-site-search" id="site-search-btn">
    <label for="header-search" class="hidden">Search site</label>
    <div class="campl-search-input">
      <form action="https://search.cam.ac.uk/web">
      
        <input id="header-search" type="text" placeholder="Search" name="query" size="18" title="Search Site" class="text search-autocomplete" /><input type="image" class="campl-search-submit " src="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/++theme++ucam.falcon/light/images/interface/btn-search-header.png" /><input type="hidden" value="HPS" name="inst" /></form>

		<div class="campl-wrap clearfix">
			<form class="campl-site-search-form" id="site-search-container" action="https://search.cam.ac.uk/web">
    <div class="campl-search-form-wrapper clearfix">
      <input id="header-search" type="text" placeholder="Search" name="query" size="18" title="Search Site" class="text search-autocomplete" /><input type="image" class="campl-search-submit " src="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/++theme++ucam.falcon/light/images/interface/btn-search-header.png" /><input type="hidden" value="HPS" name="inst" /></div>
  </form>
    <script type="text/javascript">
        /* there are two auto-completion plugins and the wrong one wins.
         * Create the jQuery UI widget *directly* by instanciating a widget 
         * for each object manually, adding it to the element data.
         */
        var widget = $.ui.autocomplete,
            fullname = 'ui-autocomplete',
            search_inst = $('#site-search-btn input[type=hidden][name=inst]').val(),
            options = {
                source: function(request, response) {
                    $.ajax({
                        url: "http://api.search.cam.ac.uk/suggest",
                        dataType: "jsonp",
                        data: { term: request.term, inst: search_inst },
                        success: response
                    })
                },
                select: function(event, ui) {
                    // Submit the form on select
                    $(this).val(ui.item.value);
                    $(this).context.form.submit();
                }
            };
        /* NB: Following jQuery selector matches mobile AND desktop views */
        $("input.search-autocomplete").each(function () {
            var instance = $.data(this, fullname, new widget(options, this));
        });
    </script>
		</div>

        <div class="" id="parent-fieldname-text-d51d35e76d7b4a07a6be34cc18a60de1">
            <div style="float: left; width: 49%;">
<h2 style="padding-top: 0; "><a title="" href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/undergraduate" class="internal-link" target="_self">Undergraduate study</a></h2>
<p>History and Philosophy of Science courses for students in their second, third and fourth year</p>
<p><a title="" href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/undergraduate" class="internal-link campl-primary-cta" target="_self">Read more</a></p>
</div>
<div style="float: right; width: 49%;">
<h2 style="padding-top: 0; "><a title="" href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/graduate" class="internal-link" target="_self">Graduate study</a></h2>
<p>Join us to study for an MPhil or PhD in History and Philosophy of Science</p>
<p><a title="" href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/graduate" class="internal-link campl-primary-cta" target="_self">Read more</a></p>
</div>
            
        </div>

$(document).ready(function(){
    var contentWidth = $('#content').width();

    $("dl.image-inline.captioned, dl.image-left.captioned, dl.image-right.captioned").each(function() {
        var caption = $(this).find('.image-caption');
        var img     = $(this).find('img');
        var width   = img.width()
        var ratio   = (width < contentWidth) ? width / contentWidth : 1;

        $(this).removeAttr('style');
        caption.removeAttr('style');

        img.removeAttr('width');
        img.removeAttr('height');
        img.css('max-width', "100%");
        img.css('height', "auto");

        $(this).css('max-width', (ratio * 100.0) + '%');
    })
});

				<div class="campl-site-search" id="site-search-btn">
    <label for="header-search" class="hidden">Search site</label>
    <div class="campl-search-input">
      <form action="https://search.cam.ac.uk/web">
      
        <input id="header-search" type="text" placeholder="Search" name="query" size="18" title="Search Site" class="text search-autocomplete" /><input type="image" class="campl-search-submit " src="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/++theme++ucam.falcon/light/images/interface/btn-search-header.png" /><input type="hidden" value="HPS" name="inst" /></form>

	</div><div class="campl-row campl-global-header campl-search-drawer">
		<div class="campl-wrap clearfix">
			<form class="campl-site-search-form" id="site-search-container" action="https://search.cam.ac.uk/web">
    <div class="campl-search-form-wrapper clearfix">
      <input id="header-search" type="text" placeholder="Search" name="query" size="18" title="Search Site" class="text search-autocomplete" /><input type="image" class="campl-search-submit " src="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/++theme++ucam.falcon/light/images/interface/btn-search-header.png" /><input type="hidden" value="HPS" name="inst" /></div>
  </form>
    <script type="text/javascript">
        /* there are two auto-completion plugins and the wrong one wins.
         * Create the jQuery UI widget *directly* by instanciating a widget 
         * for each object manually, adding it to the element data.
         */
        var widget = $.ui.autocomplete,
            fullname = 'ui-autocomplete',
            search_inst = $('#site-search-btn input[type=hidden][name=inst]').val(),
            options = {
                source: function(request, response) {
                    $.ajax({
                        url: "http://api.search.cam.ac.uk/suggest",
                        dataType: "jsonp",
                        data: { term: request.term, inst: search_inst },
                        success: response
                    })
                },
                select: function(event, ui) {
                    // Submit the form on select
                    $(this).val(ui.item.value);
                    $(this).context.form.submit();
                }
            };
        /* NB: Following jQuery selector matches mobile AND desktop views */
        $("input.search-autocomplete").each(function () {
            var instance = $.data(this, fullname, new widget(options, this));
        });
    </script>
		</div>
	</div>

                    Graduate study
                </h1>

  <div class="campl-tertiary-navigation">

				<div class="campl-column6  campl-main-content" id="campl-content"><div class="clearfix campl-carousel" id="campl-carousel">
        
          <div class="campl-carousel-container">
            <ul class="campl-unstyled-list campl-slides"><li class="campl-slide campl-column12">
  <div class="image-container">
    
      <img alt="darton-globe.jpg" class="campl-scale-with-grid" src="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/images/carousel/darton-globe/@@images/5a0b73e1-247c-430a-8b47-760286e34032.jpeg" title="Three-inch pocket globe in case with celestial sphere, by Darton and Co, 1811 (Image credit: Whipple Museum of the History of Science, University of Cambridge)" /></div>

            <div id="viewlet-above-content">
</div>

            
                <div class="">

                    

                    

    <dl class="portalMessage info" id="kssPortalMessage" style="display:none"><dt>Info</dt>
        <dd></dd>
    </dl><div id="content">

                            

                            

                             <div id="viewlet-above-content-title">


</div>
                             
                                 
                                 
            
                
            
            
        
                             
                             <div id="viewlet-below-content-title">
</div>

                             
                                 
                                 
            
                
            
            
        
                             

                             <div id="viewlet-above-content-body">



</div>
                             <div id="content-core">
                                 
    
        
        <div class="" id="parent-fieldname-text-39337ed63b964ac3b438802928d67d75">
            <p class="first">If you are interested in studying for an MPhil or PhD in History and Philosophy of Science at Cambridge, these pages are for you.</p>
<p>Here you will find an introduction to the Department, the courses and the application process, with links to further information on the University's Graduate Admissions website.</p>
<p>Applicants can choose from three options:</p>
<div class="info-box-full">
<h2 style="padding-top: 0; "><a title="" href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/graduate/mphil-hpsm" class="internal-link" target="_self">MPhil in History and Philosophy of Science and Medicine</a></h2>
<p>This MPhil (Master of Philosophy) provides students with an unparalleled opportunity to explore topics across history and philosophy of science and medicine, laying deep foundations for further study, work and public involvement. The course is taught by lectures, seminars and supervisions, and assessed by three research essays and a dissertation.</p>
</div>
<div class="info-box-full">
<h2 style="padding-top: 0; "><a href="http://www.hms.hps.cam.ac.uk/">MPhil in Health, Medicine and Society</a></h2>
<p>This new MPhil course – run jointly with the Division of Social Anthropology and Department of Sociology – offers a uniquely interdisciplinary approach to teaching and research on health, medicine and society. No other programme can match Cambridge's breadth and concentration of expertise in this rapidly expanding and exciting subject area.</p>
</div>
<div class="info-box-full">
<h2 style="padding-top: 0; "><a title="" href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/graduate/phd" class="internal-link" target="_self">PhD in History and Philosophy of Science</a></h2>
<p>The PhD (Doctor of Philosophy) is a research degree. Applicants will be admitted directly to the PhD only if they already have an exceptionally strong background in the field – usually through the MPhil or Part III course in this department or a similar course at another university – and an appropriate and focused research proposal.</p>
</div>
<p class="footer-caption">Main image: Three-inch pocket globe in case with celestial sphere, by Darton and Co, 1811<br />Image credit: Whipple Museum of the History of Science, University of Cambridge</p>
            
        </div>
    
    

                             </div>
                             <div id="viewlet-below-content-body">





    <div class="visualClear"><!-- --></div>

    <div class="documentActions">
        

        

    </div>

</div>

                            
                        </div>
                    

                    
                </div>
            

            <div id="viewlet-below-content">





</div>
        </div></div>
				<div class="campl-column3 campl-secondary-content">
            
                
<div class="portletWrapper" data-portlethash="706c6f6e652e7269676874636f6c756d6e0a636f6e746578740a2f4850534d41494e2f73747564792f67726164756174652f67726164756174652d6f766572766965770a6c696e6b73" id="portletwrapper-706c6f6e652e7269676874636f6c756d6e0a636f6e746578740a2f4850534d41494e2f73747564792f67726164756174652f67726164756174652d6f766572766965770a6c696e6b73"><div class="campl-content-container falcon-linkbox-portlet">
    <div class="campl-heading-container">
        <h2>Links</h2>
        
    </div>
    <ul class="campl-unstyled-list campl-related-links"><li><a href="http://www.graduate.study.cam.ac.uk/">Graduate Admissions</a></li>
        
    </ul></div>
</div>

<div class="portletWrapper" data-portlethash="706c6f6e652e7269676874636f6c756d6e0a636f6e746578740a2f4850534d41494e2f73747564792f67726164756174650a65752d7175657374696f6e732d616e642d616e7377657273" id="portletwrapper-706c6f6e652e7269676874636f6c756d6e0a636f6e746578740a2f4850534d41494e2f73747564792f67726164756174650a65752d7175657374696f6e732d616e642d616e7377657273">
  <div class="campl-content-container">
  <div class="campl-teaser campl-promo-teaser campl-vertical-teaser">
    <div class="campl-content-container campl-vertical-teaser-txt">
      <p class="campl-teaser-title">
          <a href="http://www.eu.admin.cam.ac.uk/audiences/postgraduate-students">EU Questions and Answers</a></p>
    </div>
    
      <div class="campl-content-container campl-vertical-teaser-img">
        <a href="http://www.eu.admin.cam.ac.uk/audiences/postgraduate-students" class="campl-teaser-img-link">
            
            
            <img class="campl-scale-with-grid" src="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/images/right-column-teasers/eu-flag-teaser/@@images/e021650c-1c47-460d-9468-8d7e4bce09d8.jpeg" alt="eu-flag-teaser.jpg" /></a>
      </div>
    
    <div class="campl-content-container campl-vertical-teaser-txt clearfix">
      <p>How will the University of Cambridge be affected by the UK leaving the European Union?</p>
      
        
        <a href="http://www.eu.admin.cam.ac.uk/audiences/postgraduate-students" class="campl-secondary-cta campl-float-right">More</a>
      
    </div>
  </div>
  </div>

</div>




            
        </div>

$(document).ready(function(){
    var contentWidth = $('#content').width();

    $("dl.image-inline.captioned, dl.image-left.captioned, dl.image-right.captioned").each(function() {
        var caption = $(this).find('.image-caption');
        var img     = $(this).find('img');
        var width   = img.width()
        var ratio   = (width < contentWidth) ? width / contentWidth : 1;

        $(this).removeAttr('style');
        caption.removeAttr('style');

        img.removeAttr('width');
        img.removeAttr('height');
        img.css('max-width', "100%");
        img.css('height', "auto");

        $(this).css('max-width', (ratio * 100.0) + '%');
    })
});

      <form action="https://search.cam.ac.uk/web">
      
        <input id="header-search" type="text" placeholder="Search" name="query" size="18" title="Search Site" class="text search-autocomplete" /><input type="image" class="campl-search-submit " src="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/++theme++ucam.falcon/light/images/interface/btn-search-header.png" /><input type="hidden" value="HPS" name="inst" /></form>

			<form class="campl-site-search-form" id="site-search-container" action="https://search.cam.ac.uk/web">
    <div class="campl-search-form-wrapper clearfix">
      <input id="header-search" type="text" placeholder="Search" name="query" size="18" title="Search Site" class="text search-autocomplete" /><input type="image" class="campl-search-submit " src="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/++theme++ucam.falcon/light/images/interface/btn-search-header.png" /><input type="hidden" value="HPS" name="inst" /></div>
  </form>
    <script type="text/javascript">
        /* there are two auto-completion plugins and the wrong one wins.
         * Create the jQuery UI widget *directly* by instanciating a widget 
         * for each object manually, adding it to the element data.
         */
        var widget = $.ui.autocomplete,
            fullname = 'ui-autocomplete',
            search_inst = $('#site-search-btn input[type=hidden][name=inst]').val(),
            options = {
                source: function(request, response) {
                    $.ajax({
                        url: "http://api.search.cam.ac.uk/suggest",
                        dataType: "jsonp",
                        data: { term: request.term, inst: search_inst },
                        success: response
                    })
                },
                select: function(event, ui) {
                    // Submit the form on select
                    $(this).val(ui.item.value);
                    $(this).context.form.submit();
                }
            };
        /* NB: Following jQuery selector matches mobile AND desktop views */
        $("input.search-autocomplete").each(function () {
            var instance = $.data(this, fullname, new widget(options, this));
        });
    </script>
		</div>

					<p class="campl-page-title">Department of History and Philosophy of Science</p>

    <dl class="portalMessage info" id="kssPortalMessage" style="display:none"><dt>Info</dt>

                             <div id="content-core">
                                 
    
        
        <div class="" id="parent-fieldname-text-772226c2f1d04a6dbb6796430cbb8d4a">
            <p><em>Please <a title="" href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/about/contact" class="internal-link" target="_self">contact the Department</a> if you would like to update or correct the information about you on this page or if you would like to join our alumni email list.</em></p>
<h2 class="clear">2017</h2>
<div class="placement-item">
<h3>Feraz Azhar</h3>
<p><strong>Thesis:</strong> Probabilistic reasoning in the inflationary universe<br /><strong>Placement after PhD:</strong> Postdoctoral Fellow, Black Hole Initiative, Harvard University</p>
</div>
<div class="placement-item">
<h3>Tillmann Taape</h3>
<p><strong>Thesis:</strong> Hieronymus Brunschwig and the making of vernacular medical knowledge in early German print<br /><strong>Placement after PhD:</strong> Postdoctoral Fellowship, Columbia University</p>
</div>
<h2 class="clear">2016</h2>
<div class="placement-item">
<h3>Leah Astbury</h3>
<p><strong>Thesis:</strong> Breeding women and lusty infants in seventeenth-century England<br /><strong>Placement after PhD:</strong> Wellcome Trust Fellow, HPS Cambridge</p>
</div>
<div class="placement-item">
<h3>Megan Barford</h3>
<p><strong>Thesis:</strong> Naval hydrography, charismatic bureaucracy and the British military state, 1825–1855<br /><strong>Placement after PhD:</strong> Curator of Cartography, Royal Museums Greenwich, London</p>
</div>
<div class="placement-item">
<h3>Riana Betzler</h3>
<p><strong>Thesis:</strong> Why empathy? The pernicious consequences of conceptual confusion in empathy research<br /><strong>Placement after PhD:</strong> Postdoctoral Fellow, Konrad Lorenz Institute for Evolution and Cognition Research</p>
</div>
<div class="placement-item">
<h3>Andrew Buskell</h3>
<p><strong>Thesis:</strong> Modelling culture: a philosophical examination of cultural dynamics and cultural evolution<br /><strong>Placement after PhD:</strong> Research Associate, LSE London<br /><strong>Last known:</strong> Research Associate, HPS Cambridge</p>
</div>
<div class="placement-item">
<h3>Seb Falk</h3>
<p><strong>Thesis:</strong> <a href="https://www.repository.cam.ac.uk/handle/1810/256996">Improving instruments: equatoria, astrolabes and the practices of monastic astronomy in late medieval England</a><br /><strong>Placement after PhD:</strong> Research Fellow, Girton College, Cambridge</p>
</div>
<h2 class="clear">2015</h2>
<div class="placement-item">
<h3>Iris Montero Sobrevilla</h3>
<p><strong>Thesis:</strong> Transatlantic hum: natural history and the itineraries of the torpid hummingbird<br /><strong>Placement after PhD:</strong> Mellon Postdoctoral Fellow in the Humanities, Brown University</p>
</div>
<div class="placement-item">
<h3>Dmitriy Myelnikov</h3>
<p><strong>Thesis:</strong> <a href="https://www.repository.cam.ac.uk/handle/1810/252737">Transforming mice: technique and communication in the making of transgenic animals, 1974–1988</a><br /><strong>Placement after PhD:</strong> Postdoctoral Researcher, University of Edinburgh<br /><strong>Last known:</strong> Research Associate, University of Manchester</p>
</div>
<div class="placement-item">
<h3>Eoin Phillips</h3>
<p><strong>Thesis:</strong> Making time fit: astronomers, artisans and the state, 1770–1820<br /><strong>Placement after PhD:</strong> Research Associate, Longitude Project, HPS Cambridge<br /><strong>Last known:</strong> Postdoctoral Fellow, CEHIC, Universitat Autonoma de Barcelona</p>
</div>
<div class="placement-item">
<h3>James Poskett</h3>
<p><strong>Thesis:</strong> Metropole of the mind: phrenology and the making of a global science, 1815–1923<br /><strong>Placement after PhD:</strong> Adrian Research Fellow, Darwin College, Cambridge<br /><strong>Last known:</strong> Assistant Professor, History, University of Warwick</p>
</div>
<div class="placement-item">
<h3>Kathryn Schoefert</h3>
<p><strong>Thesis:</strong> The view from the psychiatric laboratory: the research of Ernst Grünthal and his mid-twentieth-century peers<br /><strong>Placement after PhD:</strong> Researcher, Generation to Reproduction Project, HPS Cambridge<br /><strong>Last known:</strong> Research and Teaching Associate, King's College London</p>
</div>
<div class="placement-item">
<h3>Sophie Waring</h3>
<p><strong>Thesis:</strong> Thomas Young, the Board of Longitude and the age of reform<br /><strong>Placement after PhD:</strong> Modern Collections Curator, Museum of the History of Science, Oxford<br /><strong>Last known:</strong> Curator of Chemistry, Science Museum, London</p>
</div>
<h2 class="clear">2014</h2>
<div class="placement-item">
<h3>Shahar Avin</h3>
<p><strong>Thesis:</strong> <a href="https://www.repository.cam.ac.uk/handle/1810/247434">Breaking the grant cycle: on the rational allocation of public resources to scientific research projects</a><br /><strong>Placement after PhD:</strong> Software Engineer, Google UK Ltd<br /><strong>Last known:</strong> Postdoctoral Researcher, Centre for the Study of Existential Risk, University of Cambridge</p>
</div>
<div class="placement-item">
<h3>Sophie Brockmann</h3>
<p><strong>Thesis:</strong> Surveying nature: the creation and communication of natural-historical knowledge in Enlightenment Central America<br /><strong>Placement after PhD:</strong> Lecturer in Integrated Studies, University of Pennsylvania<br /><strong>Last known:</strong> Early Career Academic Fellow, De Montfort University, Leicester</p>
</div>
<div class="placement-item">
<h3>Will Carruthers</h3>
<p><strong>Thesis:</strong> Egyptology, archaeology and the making of revolutionary Egypt, c.1925–1958<br /><strong>Placement after PhD:</strong> Max Weber Programme Postdoctoral Fellow, Department of History and Civilization, European University Institute, Florence<br /><strong>Last known:</strong> Gerda Henkel Stiftung Postdoctoral Research Scholar/Visiting Scholar, German Historical Institute, London</p>
</div>
<div class="placement-item">
<h3>Sean Dyde</h3>
<p><strong>Thesis:</strong> Brains, minds and nerves in British medicine and physiology, 1764–1852<br /><strong>Placement after PhD:</strong> Postdoctoral Fellowship, Max Planck Institute for the History of Science, Berlin<br /><strong>Last known:</strong> Marie Curie Research Fellow, University of Leeds</p>
</div>
<div class="placement-item">
<h3>Ruth Horry</h3>
<p><strong>Thesis:</strong> Transitions and transformations in Assyriology, c.1880–1913: artefacts, academics and museums<br /><strong>Placement after PhD:</strong> Research Associate, AHRC Scholarly Libraries project, University of Cambridge<br /><strong>Last known:</strong> Curator, Wellcome Collection, London</p>
</div>
<div class="placement-item">
<h3>Josh Nall</h3>
<p><strong>Thesis:</strong> News from Mars: transatlantic mass media and the practice of new astronomy, 1870–1910<br /><strong>Placement after PhD:</strong> Assistant Curator, Whipple Museum, HPS Cambridge</p>
</div>
<div class="placement-item">
<h3>Jesse Olszynko-Gryn</h3>
<p><strong>Thesis:</strong> Pregnancy testing in Britain, c. 1900–67: laboratories, animals and demand from doctors, patients and consumers<br /><strong>Placement after PhD:</strong> Research Associate, Generation to Reproduction project, HPS Cambridge<br /><strong>Last known:</strong> Wellcome Research Fellow, HPS Cambridge</p>
</div>
<div class="placement-item">
<h3>Emma Perkins</h3>
<p><strong>Thesis:</strong> Non haberi sed esse: Tycho Brahe's self-presentation through visual and material culture<br /><strong>Placement after PhD:</strong> Research Associate, AHRC Diagrams Project, HPS Cambridge<br /><strong>Last known:</strong> Affiliated Scholar, HPS Cambridge</p>
</div>
<div class="placement-item">
<h3>Arianne Shahvisi</h3>
<p><strong>Thesis:</strong> On the nature and origins of thermodynamic asymmetry<br /><strong>Placement after PhD:</strong> Assistant Professor, Philosophy, American University of Beirut<br /><strong>Last known:</strong> Lecturer in Medical Ethics and Humanities, Brighton and Sussex Medical School</p>
</div>
<div class="placement-item">
<h3>Lena Zuchowski</h3>
<p><strong>Thesis:</strong> On the foundations of chaos and complexity: definitions and differentiations<br /><strong>Placement after PhD:</strong> Assistant Professor, University of Salzburg</p>
</div>
<h2 class="clear">2013</h2>
<div class="placement-item">
<h3>Alexandra Bacopoulos-Viau</h3>
<p><strong>Thesis:</strong> Scripting the mind: automatic writing in France, 1857–1930<br /><strong>Placement after PhD:</strong> Postdoctoral Fellow, History, New York University<br /><strong>Last known:</strong> Banting Postdoctoral Fellow, McGill University</p>
</div>
<div class="placement-item">
<h3>Jenny Bangham</h3>
<p><strong>Thesis:</strong> Blood groups and the rise of human genetics in mid-twentieth century Britain<br /><strong>Placement after PhD:</strong> Research scholar, Max Planck Institute for the History of Science, Berlin<br /><strong>Last known:</strong> Wellcome Fellow, HPS Cambridge</p>
</div>
<div class="placement-item">
<h3>Katy Barrett</h3>

</div>
<div class="placement-item">
<h3>Jonathan Birch</h3>
<p><strong>Thesis:</strong> Kin selection: a philosophical analysis<br /><strong>Placement after PhD:</strong> Junior Research Fellow, Philosophy, University of Cambridge<br /><strong>Last known:</strong> Assistant Professor, Philosophy, Logic and Scientific Method, LSE, London</p>
</div>
<div class="placement-item">
<h3>Michael Bycroft</h3>
<p><strong>Thesis:</strong> Physics and natural history in the eighteenth century: the case of Charles Dufay<br /><strong>Placement after PhD:</strong> Postdoctoral Fellowship, Max Planck Institute for the History of Science, Berlin<br /><strong>Last known:</strong> Assistant Professor, History of Science and Technology, University of Warwick</p>
</div>
<div class="placement-item">
<h3>Katharina Kraus</h3>
<p><strong>Thesis:</strong> Psychological knowledge in Kant's critical thinking<br /><strong>Placement after PhD:</strong> Postdoctoral Fellow, Hebrew University of Jerusalem<br /><strong>Last known:</strong> Assistant Professor of Philosophy, University of Notre Dame</p>
</div>
<div class="placement-item">
<h3>Allison Ksiazkiewicz</h3>
<p><strong>Thesis:</strong> Geology and neoclassical aesthetics: visualizing the structure of the Earth in late eighteenth- and early nineteenth-century Britain<br /><strong>Placement after PhD:</strong> Documentation assistant, Whipple Museum, HPS Cambridge<br /><strong>Last known:</strong> Postdoctoral Fellow, Paul Mellon Centre for British Art</p>
</div>
<div class="placement-item">
<h3>Emily McTernan</h3>
<p><strong>Thesis:</strong> Equality and responsibility<br /><strong>Placement after PhD:</strong> Lecturer, Political Theory, University College London</p>
</div>

<p><strong>Thesis:</strong> Classifying madness: a philosophical examination of the diagnostic and statistical manual of mental disorders<br /><strong>Placement after PhD:</strong> Lecturer, Philosophy, Lancaster University<br /><strong>Last known:</strong> Senior Lecturer, Philosophy, Lancaster University</p>
</div>
<div class="placement-item">
<h3>Jim Endersby</h3>
<p><strong>Thesis:</strong> Putting plants in their place: Joseph Hooker's philosophical botany, 1838–1865<br /><strong>Placement after PhD:</strong> Postdoctoral Research Fellow, Darwin College, Cambridge<br /><strong>Last known:</strong> Reader, History of Science, University of Sussex</p>
</div>
<div class="placement-item">
<h3>Gerald Kutcher</h3>
<p><strong>Thesis:</strong> Clinical ethics and research imperatives in human radiation experiments: a case of contested conduct<br /><strong>Placement after PhD:</strong> Assistant Professor, History of Science, Technology and Medicine, SUNY Binghamton<br /><strong>Last known:</strong> Professor, History of Science, Technology and Medicine, SUNY Binghamton</p>
</div>
<div class="placement-item">
<h3>Wen-Ji Wang</h3>
<p><strong>Thesis:</strong> A genealogy for the psychoanalyst: <em>Bildung</em>, experiment, and the training of the psychoanalyst<br /><strong>Placement after PhD:</strong> Postdoctoral Fellowship, Institute of History and Philology, Academia Sinica, Taiwan<br /><strong>Last known:</strong> Associate Professor, Institute of Science, Technology and Society, National Yang-Ming University, Taiwan</p>
</div>
<h2 class="clear">2001</h2>
<div class="placement-item">
<h3>Anjan Chakravartty</h3>
<p><strong>Thesis:</strong> Semirealism: the metaphysical foundations of scientific realism<br /><strong>Placement after PhD:</strong> Assistant Professor, Department of Philosophy, University of Toronto<br /><strong>Last known:</strong> Professor and Director, John J. Reilly Center for Science, Technology and Values, Notre Dame, USA</p>
</div>
<div class="placement-item">
<h3>Talal Debs</h3>
<p><strong>Thesis:</strong> Representation and symmetry: an analysis of the tension between objectivity and conventionality in modern physics<br /><strong>Placement after PhD:</strong> Research Associate, Centre for Philosophy of Natural and Social Science, LSE<br /><strong>Last known:</strong> Executive Director, JP Morgan, NY</p>
</div>
<div class="placement-item">
<h3>Cathy Gere</h3>
<p><strong>Thesis:</strong> Psyche's labyrinth: Minoan archaeology and modern prophecy, 1900–1945<br /><strong>Placement after PhD:</strong> Wellcome Trust Research Associate, King's College, Cambridge<br /><strong>Last known:</strong> Associate Professor, History and Science Studies, University of California, San Diego</p>
</div>
<div class="placement-item">
<h3>Christopher Haley</h3>
<p><strong>Thesis:</strong> Envisioning the unseen universe: models of the ether in the nineteenth century<br /><strong>Placement after PhD:</strong> Departmental Archivist and Historian, Department of Chemistry, University of Cambridge<br /><strong>Last known:</strong> Executive Director, Policy and Research, Nesta, London</p>
</div>
<div class="placement-item">
<h3>Anandi Hattiangadi</h3>
<p><strong>Thesis:</strong> Oughts and thoughts: scepticism and the normativity of content<br /><strong>Placement after PhD:</strong> Lecturer in Philosophy, University of<br />Oxford; Tutorial Fellow, St Hilda's College, Oxford<br /><strong>Last known:</strong> Professor in Philosophy, Stockholm University; Pro<br />Futura Scientia Fellow, Swedish Collegium of Advanced Studies</p>
</div>
<div class="placement-item">
<h3>Tim Lewens</h3>
<p><strong>Thesis:</strong> Organisms and artefacts – design in nature and elsewhere<br /><strong>Placement after PhD:</strong> University Lecturer, HPS Cambridge<br /><strong>Last known:</strong> Professor, HPS Cambridge</p>
</div>
<div class="placement-item">
<h3>Michael Rich</h3>
<p><strong>Thesis:</strong> The passing of miracles: anti-realism and the success of science<br /><strong>Placement after PhD:</strong> Local government, UK</p>
</div>
<div class="placement-item">
<h3>Eugenia Roldan Vera</h3>
<p><strong>Thesis:</strong> Book export and the transmission of knowledge from Britain to early-independent Spanish America<br /><strong>Placement after PhD:</strong> Humboldt Postdoctoral Fellowship, Centre for Comparative Education, Humboldt University, Berlin<br /><strong>Last known:</strong> Professor, Department of Educational Research, Cinvestav, Mexico City</p>
</div>
<div class="placement-item">
<h3>Sujit Sivasundaram</h3>
<p><strong>Thesis:</strong> Nature speaks theology: colonialism, cultivation, conversion and the Pacific, 1795–1850<br /><strong>Placement after PhD:</strong> Research Fellow, Gonville and Caius College, Cambridge<br /><strong>Last known:</strong> Reader in World History, Faculty of History, University of Cambridge</p>
</div>
<div class="placement-item">
<h3>John Tresch</h3>
<p><strong>Thesis:</strong> Mechanical romanticism: engineers of the artificial paradise<br /><strong>Placement after PhD:</strong> Assistant Professor, History and Sociology of Science, University of Pennsylvania</p>
</div>
<div class="placement-item">
<h3>Joerg Tuske</h3>
<p><strong>Thesis:</strong> Is emotion the colour of thought? Philosophical reflections<br /><strong>Placement after PhD:</strong> Assistant Editor, Wittgenstein Archive, Cambridge<br /><strong>Last known:</strong> Professor, Philosophy, Salisbury University, Maryland, USA</p>
</div>
<div class="placement-item">
<h3>Karin Tybjerg</h3>
<p><strong>Thesis:</strong> Doing philosophy with machines: Hero of Alexandria's rhetoric of mechanics in relation to the contemporary philosophy<br /><strong>Placement after PhD:</strong> Moses and Mary Finley Research Fellowship, Darwin College, Cambridge<br /><strong>Last known:</strong> Associate Professor, Medical Museion, University of Copenhagen</p>
</div>
            
        </div>

$(document).ready(function(){
    var contentWidth = $('#content').width();

    $("dl.image-inline.captioned, dl.image-left.captioned, dl.image-right.captioned").each(function() {
        var caption = $(this).find('.image-caption');
        var img     = $(this).find('img');
        var width   = img.width()
        var ratio   = (width < contentWidth) ? width / contentWidth : 1;

        $(this).removeAttr('style');
        caption.removeAttr('style');

        img.removeAttr('width');
        img.removeAttr('height');
        img.css('max-width', "100%");
        img.css('height', "auto");

        $(this).css('max-width', (ratio * 100.0) + '%');
    })
});

            }
        });
        </script><meta name="DC.creator" content="dt243@cam.ac.uk" /><meta name="DC.format" content="text/html" /><meta name="DC.language" content="en" /><meta name="DC.date.modified" content="2016-07-14T14:34:23+00:00" /><meta name="DC.date.created" content="2016-07-14T13:21:28+00:00" /><meta name="DC.type" content="Page" /><meta name="DC.distribution" content="Global" /><meta name="robots" content="ALL" /><meta name="distribution" content="Global" /></head><body class="template-document_view portaltype-document site-HPSMAIN section-study subsection-undergraduate subsection-undergraduate-undergraduate-overview icons-on userrole-anonymous campl-theme-1"><!--[if lt IE 7]>

		<div class="campl-wrap clearfix">	
			<div class="campl-header-container campl-column8" id="global-header-controls">
				<a href="http://www.cam.ac.uk" class="campl-main-logo">
					<img alt="University of Cambridge" src="/++theme++ucam.falcon/light/images/interface/main-logo-small.png" /></a>

				<ul class="campl-unstyled-list campl-horizontal-navigation campl-global-navigation clearfix" id="primary-nav"><li>

			<div class="campl-column2">
				
				<div class="campl-site-search" id="site-search-btn">
    <label for="header-search" class="hidden">Search site</label>
    <div class="campl-search-input">
      <form action="https://search.cam.ac.uk/web">
      
        <input id="header-search" type="text" placeholder="Search" name="query" size="18" title="Search Site" class="text search-autocomplete" /><input type="image" class="campl-search-submit " src="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/++theme++ucam.falcon/light/images/interface/btn-search-header.png" /><input type="hidden" value="HPS" name="inst" /></form>
    </div>
  </div>
			</div>
		</div>		
	</div><div class="campl-row campl-global-header campl-search-drawer">
		<div class="campl-wrap clearfix">
			<form class="campl-site-search-form" id="site-search-container" action="https://search.cam.ac.uk/web">
    <div class="campl-search-form-wrapper clearfix">
      <input id="header-search" type="text" placeholder="Search" name="query" size="18" title="Search Site" class="text search-autocomplete" /><input type="image" class="campl-search-submit " src="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/++theme++ucam.falcon/light/images/interface/btn-search-header.png" /><input type="hidden" value="HPS" name="inst" /></div>
  </form>
    <script type="text/javascript">
        /* there are two auto-completion plugins and the wrong one wins.
         * Create the jQuery UI widget *directly* by instanciating a widget 
         * for each object manually, adding it to the element data.
         */
        var widget = $.ui.autocomplete,
            fullname = 'ui-autocomplete',
            search_inst = $('#site-search-btn input[type=hidden][name=inst]').val(),
            options = {
                source: function(request, response) {
                    $.ajax({
                        url: "http://api.search.cam.ac.uk/suggest",
                        dataType: "jsonp",
                        data: { term: request.term, inst: search_inst },
                        success: response
                    })
                },
                select: function(event, ui) {
                    // Submit the form on select
                    $(this).val(ui.item.value);
                    $(this).context.form.submit();
                }
            };
        /* NB: Following jQuery selector matches mobile AND desktop views */
        $("input.search-autocomplete").each(function () {
            var instance = $.data(this, fullname, new widget(options, this));
        });
    </script>
		</div>
	</div>

                <div class="">

                    

                    

    <dl class="portalMessage info" id="kssPortalMessage" style="display:none"><dt>Info</dt>
        <dd></dd>
    </dl><div id="content">

                            

                            

                             <div id="viewlet-above-content-title">


</div>
                             
                                 
                                 
            
                
            
            
        
                             
                             <div id="viewlet-below-content-title">
</div>

                             
                                 
                                 
            
                
            
            
        
                             

                             <div id="viewlet-above-content-body">



</div>
                             <div id="content-core">
                                 
    
        
        <div class="" id="parent-fieldname-text-8f71ff45dbc047a6abe17f078d9fc3ec">
            <p>History and Philosophy of Science is available as an option for students in their <a title="Part IB" href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/undergraduate/partib" class="internal-link" target="_self">second</a>, <a title="Part II" href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/undergraduate/partii" class="internal-link" target="_self">third</a> and <a title="Part III" href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/undergraduate/partiii" class="internal-link" target="_self">fourth</a> year at Cambridge.</p>
<p>On these pages you will find an <a title="" href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/undergraduate/introducing" class="internal-link" target="_self">introduction</a> to the subject, answers to some <a title="" href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/undergraduate/faqs" class="internal-link" target="_self">frequently asked questions</a>, and an outline of the different <a title="" href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/undergraduate/routes" class="internal-link" target="_self">routes into HPS</a>.</p>
<p>For information about applying to Cambridge, please see the University's <a href="http://www.undergraduate.study.cam.ac.uk/">Undergraduate Admissions</a> website.</p>
            
        </div>
    
    

                             </div>
                             <div id="viewlet-below-content-body">





    <div class="visualClear"><!-- --></div>

    <div class="documentActions">
        

        

    </div>

</div>

                            
                        </div>
                    

                    
                </div>
            

            <div id="viewlet-below-content">





</div>
        </div></div>
				<div class="campl-column3 campl-secondary-content">
            
                
<div class="portletWrapper" data-portlethash="706c6f6e652e7269676874636f6c756d6e0a636f6e746578740a2f4850534d41494e2f73747564792f756e64657267726164756174652f756e64657267726164756174652d6f766572766965770a706f72746c65745f7374617469632d31" id="portletwrapper-706c6f6e652e7269676874636f6c756d6e0a636f6e746578740a2f4850534d41494e2f73747564792f756e64657267726164756174652f756e64657267726164756174652d6f766572766965770a706f72746c65745f7374617469632d31">
<div class="campl-content-container falcon-static-portlet">
  <div class="portlet-static"><blockquote class="clearfix embed-quote-full">
<p class="campl-quote-mark">I enjoyed every minute of working in this friendly, supportive and vibrant department. HPS has something for everyone and I thoroughly recommend it.</p>
</blockquote>
<p><a class="internal-link campl-primary-cta" href="resolveuid/eff6c831f9af402bbf433a3b7ae744e8" target="_self" title="">More comments from our students</a></p></div>

$(document).ready(function(){
    var contentWidth = $('#content').width();

    $("dl.image-inline.captioned, dl.image-left.captioned, dl.image-right.captioned").each(function() {
        var caption = $(this).find('.image-caption');
        var img     = $(this).find('img');
        var width   = img.width()
        var ratio   = (width < contentWidth) ? width / contentWidth : 1;

        $(this).removeAttr('style');
        caption.removeAttr('style');

        img.removeAttr('width');
        img.removeAttr('height');
        img.css('max-width', "100%");
        img.css('height', "auto");

        $(this).css('max-width', (ratio * 100.0) + '%');
    })
});

    <label for="header-search" class="hidden">Search site</label>
    <div class="campl-search-input">
      <form action="https://search.cam.ac.uk/web">
      
        <input id="header-search" type="text" placeholder="Search" name="query" size="18" title="Search Site" class="text search-autocomplete" /><input type="image" class="campl-search-submit " src="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/++theme++ucam.falcon/light/images/interface/btn-search-header.png" /><input type="hidden" value="HPS" name="inst" /></form>

		<div class="campl-wrap clearfix">
			<form class="campl-site-search-form" id="site-search-container" action="https://search.cam.ac.uk/web">
    <div class="campl-search-form-wrapper clearfix">
      <input id="header-search" type="text" placeholder="Search" name="query" size="18" title="Search Site" class="text search-autocomplete" /><input type="image" class="campl-search-submit " src="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/++theme++ucam.falcon/light/images/interface/btn-search-header.png" /><input type="hidden" value="HPS" name="inst" /></div>
  </form>
    <script type="text/javascript">
        /* there are two auto-completion plugins and the wrong one wins.
         * Create the jQuery UI widget *directly* by instanciating a widget 
         * for each object manually, adding it to the element data.
         */
        var widget = $.ui.autocomplete,
            fullname = 'ui-autocomplete',
            search_inst = $('#site-search-btn input[type=hidden][name=inst]').val(),
            options = {
                source: function(request, response) {
                    $.ajax({
                        url: "http://api.search.cam.ac.uk/suggest",
                        dataType: "jsonp",
                        data: { term: request.term, inst: search_inst },
                        success: response
                    })
                },
                select: function(event, ui) {
                    // Submit the form on select
                    $(this).val(ui.item.value);
                    $(this).context.form.submit();
                }
            };
        /* NB: Following jQuery selector matches mobile AND desktop views */
        $("input.search-autocomplete").each(function () {
            var instance = $.data(this, fullname, new widget(options, this));
        });
    </script>
		</div>
	</div>

            <ul class="campl-unstyled-list campl-slides"><li class="campl-slide campl-column12">
  <div class="image-container">
    
      <img alt="watson-crick-dna.jpg" class="campl-scale-with-grid" src="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/images/carousel/watson-crick-dna/@@images/8aa4b080-0bff-4094-aad5-b40ee063b811.jpeg" title="Watson and Crick with their DNA model" /></div>

            <div id="viewlet-above-content">
</div>

            
                <div class="">

                    

                    

    <dl class="portalMessage info" id="kssPortalMessage" style="display:none"><dt>Info</dt>
        <dd></dd>
    </dl><div id="content">

                            

                            

                             <div id="viewlet-above-content-title">


</div>
                             
                                 
                                 
            
                
            
            
        
                             
                             <div id="viewlet-below-content-title">
</div>

                             
                                 
                                 
            
                
            
            
        
                             

                             <div id="viewlet-above-content-body">



</div>
                             <div id="content-core">
                                 
    
        
        <div class="" id="parent-fieldname-text-39578582e44b483fa34f6c341c6ca6de">
            <p class="first">The Department provides training in history of medicine at every level.</p>
<p>The Part II (third-year), Part III (fourth-year) and MPhil courses allow students to specialise largely in history of medicine or learn a little medical history to complement other interests in history, philosophy and sociology of science and technology. We offer PhD supervision in a very wide range of fields.</p>
<p>For more information on courses, see <a title="" href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/undergraduate" class="internal-link" target="_self">undergraduate study</a> and <a title="" href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/graduate" class="internal-link" target="_self">graduate study</a>.</p>
<p>For information on funding, including Wellcome master's awards and doctoral studentships, see <a title="" href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/graduate/funding" class="internal-link" target="_self">funding for graduate students</a>.</p>
            
        </div>
    
    

                             </div>
                             <div id="viewlet-below-content-body">





    <div class="visualClear"><!-- --></div>

    <div class="documentActions">
        

        

    </div>

</div>

                            
                        </div>
                    

                    
                </div>
            

            <div id="viewlet-below-content">





</div>
        </div></div>
				<div class="campl-column3 campl-secondary-content">
            
                
<div class="portletWrapper" data-portlethash="706c6f6e652e7269676874636f6c756d6e0a636f6e746578740a2f4850534d41494e2f6d65646963696e650a67656e65726174696f6e2d746f2d726570726f64756374696f6e" id="portletwrapper-706c6f6e652e7269676874636f6c756d6e0a636f6e746578740a2f4850534d41494e2f6d65646963696e650a67656e65726174696f6e2d746f2d726570726f64756374696f6e">
  <div class="campl-content-container">
  <div class="campl-teaser campl-promo-teaser campl-vertical-teaser">
    <div class="campl-content-container campl-vertical-teaser-txt">
      <p class="campl-teaser-title">
          <a href="http://www.reproduction.group.cam.ac.uk/">Generation to Reproduction</a></p>
    </div>
    
      <div class="campl-content-container campl-vertical-teaser-img">
        <a href="http://www.reproduction.group.cam.ac.uk/" class="campl-teaser-img-link">
            
            
            <img class="campl-scale-with-grid" src="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/images/right-column-teasers/repro-teaser/@@images/c29559db-488b-411a-9f3e-3b8c7cbdc6df.jpeg" alt="repro-teaser.jpg" /></a>
      </div>
    
    <div class="campl-content-container campl-vertical-teaser-txt clearfix">
      <p>Cambridge historians of medicine and biology are using a Wellcome strategic award to take a concerted approach to the history of reproduction.</p>
      
        
        <a href="http://www.reproduction.group.cam.ac.uk/" class="campl-secondary-cta campl-float-right">More</a>
      
    </div>
  </div>
  </div>

</div>

<div class="portletWrapper" data-portlethash="706c6f6e652e7269676874636f6c756d6e0a636f6e746578740a2f4850534d41494e2f6d65646963696e650a6d616b696e672d76697369626c652d656d6272796f73" id="portletwrapper-706c6f6e652e7269676874636f6c756d6e0a636f6e746578740a2f4850534d41494e2f6d65646963696e650a6d616b696e672d76697369626c652d656d6272796f73">
  <div class="campl-content-container">
  <div class="campl-teaser campl-promo-teaser campl-vertical-teaser">
    <div class="campl-content-container campl-vertical-teaser-txt">
      <p class="campl-teaser-title">
          <a href="http://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/visibleembryos/">Making Visible Embryos</a></p>
    </div>
    
      <div class="campl-content-container campl-vertical-teaser-img">
        <a href="http://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/visibleembryos/" class="campl-teaser-img-link">
            
            
            <img class="campl-scale-with-grid" src="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/images/right-column-teasers/embryos-teaser/@@images/740a4181-647b-4946-8930-e673293ca561.jpeg" alt="embryos-teaser.jpg" /></a>
      </div>
    
    <div class="campl-content-container campl-vertical-teaser-txt clearfix">
      <p>Explore our online exhibition on the history of embryo images.</p>
      
        
        <a href="http://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/visibleembryos/" class="campl-secondary-cta campl-float-right">More</a>
      
    </div>
  </div>
  </div>

</div>

<div class="portletWrapper" data-portlethash="706c6f6e652e7269676874636f6c756d6e0a636f6e746578740a2f4850534d41494e2f6d65646963696e650a7468652d63617365626f6f6b732d70726f6a656374" id="portletwrapper-706c6f6e652e7269676874636f6c756d6e0a636f6e746578740a2f4850534d41494e2f6d65646963696e650a7468652d63617365626f6f6b732d70726f6a656374">
  <div class="campl-content-container">
  <div class="campl-teaser campl-promo-teaser campl-vertical-teaser">
    <div class="campl-content-container campl-vertical-teaser-txt">
      <p class="campl-teaser-title">
          <a href="http://www.magicandmedicine.hps.cam.ac.uk/">The Casebooks Project</a></p>
    </div>
    
      <div class="campl-content-container campl-vertical-teaser-img">
        <a href="http://www.magicandmedicine.hps.cam.ac.uk/" class="campl-teaser-img-link">
            
            
            <img class="campl-scale-with-grid" src="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/images/right-column-teasers/casebooks-teaser/@@images/2ecfed01-1f29-43c5-9cb5-9d00f6cbc2fc.jpeg" alt="casebooks-teaser.jpg" /></a>
      </div>
    
    <div class="campl-content-container campl-vertical-teaser-txt clearfix">
      <p>Browse and search Simon Forman's and Richard Napier's records of thousands of consultations.</p>
      
        
        <a href="http://www.magicandmedicine.hps.cam.ac.uk/" class="campl-secondary-cta campl-float-right">More</a>
      
    </div>
  </div>
  </div>

        </div>
			</div>	
		</div><div class="campl-row campl-local-footer" id="falcon-local-footer">
  <div class="campl-wrap clearfix">
    <div class="campl-column3 campl-footer-navigation">
    
      <div class="campl-content-container campl-navigation-list&#10;            falcon-linkbox-portlet">
  
    
    <h3>
      <a href="http://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/">Department of History and Philosophy of Science</a>
    </h3>
  

  <ul class="campl-unstyled-list"><li><a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/about/contact">Contact us</a></li>
        
        <li><a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/email-search">Email search</a></li>
        
        <li><a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/privacy-and-cookie-policies">Privacy and cookie policies</a></li>
        
  </ul></div>

      
    

</div>
    <div class="campl-column3 campl-footer-navigation">
    
      <div class="campl-content-container campl-navigation-list&#10;            falcon-linkbox-portlet">

$(document).ready(function(){
    var contentWidth = $('#content').width();

    $("dl.image-inline.captioned, dl.image-left.captioned, dl.image-right.captioned").each(function() {
        var caption = $(this).find('.image-caption');
        var img     = $(this).find('img');
        var width   = img.width()
        var ratio   = (width < contentWidth) ? width / contentWidth : 1;

        $(this).removeAttr('style');
        caption.removeAttr('style');

        img.removeAttr('width');
        img.removeAttr('height');
        img.css('max-width', "100%");
        img.css('height', "auto");

        $(this).css('max-width', (ratio * 100.0) + '%');
    })
});
</script></body></html>

    <div class="campl-search-input">
      <form action="https://search.cam.ac.uk/web">
      
        <input id="header-search" type="text" placeholder="Search" name="query" size="18" title="Search Site" class="text search-autocomplete" /><input type="image" class="campl-search-submit " src="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/++theme++ucam.falcon/light/images/interface/btn-search-header.png" /><input type="hidden" value="HPS" name="inst" /></form>

			<form class="campl-site-search-form" id="site-search-container" action="https://search.cam.ac.uk/web">
    <div class="campl-search-form-wrapper clearfix">
      <input id="header-search" type="text" placeholder="Search" name="query" size="18" title="Search Site" class="text search-autocomplete" /><input type="image" class="campl-search-submit " src="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/++theme++ucam.falcon/light/images/interface/btn-search-header.png" /><input type="hidden" value="HPS" name="inst" /></div>
  </form>
    <script type="text/javascript">
        /* there are two auto-completion plugins and the wrong one wins.
         * Create the jQuery UI widget *directly* by instanciating a widget 
         * for each object manually, adding it to the element data.
         */
        var widget = $.ui.autocomplete,
            fullname = 'ui-autocomplete',
            search_inst = $('#site-search-btn input[type=hidden][name=inst]').val(),
            options = {
                source: function(request, response) {
                    $.ajax({
                        url: "http://api.search.cam.ac.uk/suggest",
                        dataType: "jsonp",
                        data: { term: request.term, inst: search_inst },
                        success: response
                    })
                },
                select: function(event, ui) {
                    // Submit the form on select
                    $(this).val(ui.item.value);
                    $(this).context.form.submit();
                }
            };
        /* NB: Following jQuery selector matches mobile AND desktop views */
        $("input.search-autocomplete").each(function () {
            var instance = $.data(this, fullname, new widget(options, this));
        });
    </script>
		</div>

        <div class="" id="parent-fieldname-text-d51d35e76d7b4a07a6be34cc18a60de1">
            <div style="float: left; width: 49%;">
<h2 style="padding-top: 0; "><a title="" href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/undergraduate" class="internal-link" target="_self">Undergraduate study</a></h2>
<p>History and Philosophy of Science courses for students in their second, third and fourth year</p>
<p><a title="" href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/undergraduate" class="internal-link campl-primary-cta" target="_self">Read more</a></p>
</div>
<div style="float: right; width: 49%;">
<h2 style="padding-top: 0; "><a title="" href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/graduate" class="internal-link" target="_self">Graduate study</a></h2>
<p>Join us to study for an MPhil or PhD in History and Philosophy of Science</p>
<p><a title="" href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/graduate" class="internal-link campl-primary-cta" target="_self">Read more</a></p>
</div>
            
        </div>

<![endif]--><script type="text/javascript" src="/++theme++ucam.falcon/light/javascripts/libs/ios-orientationchange-fix.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="/++theme++ucam.falcon/light/javascripts/libs/modernizr.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="/++theme++ucam.falcon/light/javascripts/custom.js"></script><script type="text/javascript">
$(document).ready(function(){
    var contentWidth = $('#content').width();

    $("dl.image-inline.captioned, dl.image-left.captioned, dl.image-right.captioned").each(function() {
        var caption = $(this).find('.image-caption');
        var img     = $(this).find('img');
        var width   = img.width()
        var ratio   = (width < contentWidth) ? width / contentWidth : 1;

        $(this).removeAttr('style');
        caption.removeAttr('style');

        img.removeAttr('width');
        img.removeAttr('height');
        img.css('max-width', "100%");
        img.css('height', "auto");

        $(this).css('max-width', (ratio * 100.0) + '%');
    })
});
</script></body></html>

				<div class="campl-site-search" id="site-search-btn">
    <label for="header-search" class="hidden">Search site</label>
    <div class="campl-search-input">
      <form action="https://search.cam.ac.uk/web">
      
        <input id="header-search" type="text" placeholder="Search" name="query" size="18" title="Search Site" class="text search-autocomplete" /><input type="image" class="campl-search-submit " src="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/++theme++ucam.falcon/light/images/interface/btn-search-header.png" /><input type="hidden" value="HPS" name="inst" /></form>

	</div><div class="campl-row campl-global-header campl-search-drawer">
		<div class="campl-wrap clearfix">
			<form class="campl-site-search-form" id="site-search-container" action="https://search.cam.ac.uk/web">
    <div class="campl-search-form-wrapper clearfix">
      <input id="header-search" type="text" placeholder="Search" name="query" size="18" title="Search Site" class="text search-autocomplete" /><input type="image" class="campl-search-submit " src="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/++theme++ucam.falcon/light/images/interface/btn-search-header.png" /><input type="hidden" value="HPS" name="inst" /></div>
  </form>
    <script type="text/javascript">
        /* there are two auto-completion plugins and the wrong one wins.
         * Create the jQuery UI widget *directly* by instanciating a widget 
         * for each object manually, adding it to the element data.
         */
        var widget = $.ui.autocomplete,
            fullname = 'ui-autocomplete',
            search_inst = $('#site-search-btn input[type=hidden][name=inst]').val(),
            options = {
                source: function(request, response) {
                    $.ajax({
                        url: "http://api.search.cam.ac.uk/suggest",
                        dataType: "jsonp",
                        data: { term: request.term, inst: search_inst },
                        success: response
                    })
                },
                select: function(event, ui) {
                    // Submit the form on select
                    $(this).val(ui.item.value);
                    $(this).context.form.submit();
                }
            };
        /* NB: Following jQuery selector matches mobile AND desktop views */
        $("input.search-autocomplete").each(function () {
            var instance = $.data(this, fullname, new widget(options, this));
        });
    </script>
		</div>
	</div>

			</div>
			<div class="campl-column9">
				<div class="campl-content-container">
					<h1 class="campl-sub-title">
                    Graduate study
                </h1>
				</div>
			</div>
		</div>
	</div><div class="campl-row campl-content campl-recessed-content">
			<div class="campl-wrap clearfix">
				<div class="campl-column3">
					
  <div class="campl-tertiary-navigation">
    <div class="campl-tertiary-navigation-structure">
      <ul class="campl-unstyled-list campl-vertical-breadcrumb"><li><a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk" title="Department of History and Philosophy of Science">
            Department of History and Philosophy of Science
            <span class="campl-vertical-breadcrumb-indicator"></span>
        </a></li>
        
          <li>
            <a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study" class="campl-parent-page" title="Study HPS">
              Study HPS
              <span class="campl-vertical-breadcrumb-indicator"></span>
            </a>
          </li>
        
      </ul><ul class="campl-unstyled-list campl-vertical-breadcrumb-navigation"><li class="navTreeItem visualNoMarker navTreeFolderish"><a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/undergraduate"><span>Undergraduate study</span></a>
</li>
<li class="navTreeItem visualNoMarker campl-selected navTreeFolderish"><a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/graduate" class=" navTreeCurrentItem"><span>Graduate study</span></a>
<ul class="campl-unstyled-list campl-vertical-breadcrumb-children navTree navTreeLevel1"><li class="navTreeItem visualNoMarker"><a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/graduate/why-cambridge"><span>Why study HPS at Cambridge?</span></a>
</li>
<li class="navTreeItem visualNoMarker navTreeFolderish"><a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/graduate/mphil-hpsm"><span>MPhil in History and Philosophy of Science and Medicine</span></a>
</li>

</li>

</li>

</li>

</li>

      </ul></div>
  </div>

				</div>
				<div class="campl-column6  campl-main-content" id="campl-content"><div class="clearfix campl-carousel" id="campl-carousel">
        
          <div class="campl-carousel-container">
            <ul class="campl-unstyled-list campl-slides"><li class="campl-slide campl-column12">
  <div class="image-container">
    
      <img alt="darton-globe.jpg" class="campl-scale-with-grid" src="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/images/carousel/darton-globe/@@images/5a0b73e1-247c-430a-8b47-760286e34032.jpeg" title="Three-inch pocket globe in case with celestial sphere, by Darton and Co, 1811 (Image credit: Whipple Museum of the History of Science, University of Cambridge)" /></div>
  

</li>
            </ul></div>
        
      </div><div class="campl-content-container">

            <div id="viewlet-above-content">
</div>

            
                <div class="">

                    

                    

    <dl class="portalMessage info" id="kssPortalMessage" style="display:none"><dt>Info</dt>
        <dd></dd>
    </dl><div id="content">

                            

                            

                             <div id="viewlet-above-content-title">


</div>
                             
                                 
                                 
            
                
            
            
        
                             
                             <div id="viewlet-below-content-title">
</div>

                             
                                 
                                 
            
                
            
            
        
                             

                             <div id="viewlet-above-content-body">



</div>
                             <div id="content-core">
                                 
    
        
        <div class="" id="parent-fieldname-text-39337ed63b964ac3b438802928d67d75">
            <p class="first">If you are interested in studying for an MPhil or PhD in History and Philosophy of Science at Cambridge, these pages are for you.</p>
<p>Here you will find an introduction to the Department, the courses and the application process, with links to further information on the University's Graduate Admissions website.</p>
<p>Applicants can choose from three options:</p>
<div class="info-box-full">
<h2 style="padding-top: 0; "><a title="" href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/graduate/mphil-hpsm" class="internal-link" target="_self">MPhil in History and Philosophy of Science and Medicine</a></h2>
<p>This MPhil (Master of Philosophy) provides students with an unparalleled opportunity to explore topics across history and philosophy of science and medicine, laying deep foundations for further study, work and public involvement. The course is taught by lectures, seminars and supervisions, and assessed by three research essays and a dissertation.</p>
</div>
<div class="info-box-full">
<h2 style="padding-top: 0; "><a href="http://www.hms.hps.cam.ac.uk/">MPhil in Health, Medicine and Society</a></h2>
<p>This new MPhil course – run jointly with the Division of Social Anthropology and Department of Sociology – offers a uniquely interdisciplinary approach to teaching and research on health, medicine and society. No other programme can match Cambridge's breadth and concentration of expertise in this rapidly expanding and exciting subject area.</p>
</div>
<div class="info-box-full">
<h2 style="padding-top: 0; "><a title="" href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/graduate/phd" class="internal-link" target="_self">PhD in History and Philosophy of Science</a></h2>
<p>The PhD (Doctor of Philosophy) is a research degree. Applicants will be admitted directly to the PhD only if they already have an exceptionally strong background in the field – usually through the MPhil or Part III course in this department or a similar course at another university – and an appropriate and focused research proposal.</p>
</div>
<p class="footer-caption">Main image: Three-inch pocket globe in case with celestial sphere, by Darton and Co, 1811<br />Image credit: Whipple Museum of the History of Science, University of Cambridge</p>
            
        </div>
    
    

                             </div>
                             <div id="viewlet-below-content-body">





    <div class="visualClear"><!-- --></div>

    <div class="documentActions">
        

        

    </div>

</div>

                            
                        </div>
                    

                    
                </div>
            

            <div id="viewlet-below-content">





</div>
        </div></div>
				<div class="campl-column3 campl-secondary-content">
            
                
<div class="portletWrapper" data-portlethash="706c6f6e652e7269676874636f6c756d6e0a636f6e746578740a2f4850534d41494e2f73747564792f67726164756174652f67726164756174652d6f766572766965770a6c696e6b73" id="portletwrapper-706c6f6e652e7269676874636f6c756d6e0a636f6e746578740a2f4850534d41494e2f73747564792f67726164756174652f67726164756174652d6f766572766965770a6c696e6b73"><div class="campl-content-container falcon-linkbox-portlet">

<div class="portletWrapper" data-portlethash="706c6f6e652e7269676874636f6c756d6e0a636f6e746578740a2f4850534d41494e2f73747564792f67726164756174650a65752d7175657374696f6e732d616e642d616e7377657273" id="portletwrapper-706c6f6e652e7269676874636f6c756d6e0a636f6e746578740a2f4850534d41494e2f73747564792f67726164756174650a65752d7175657374696f6e732d616e642d616e7377657273">

$(document).ready(function(){
    var contentWidth = $('#content').width();

    $("dl.image-inline.captioned, dl.image-left.captioned, dl.image-right.captioned").each(function() {
        var caption = $(this).find('.image-caption');
        var img     = $(this).find('img');
        var width   = img.width()
        var ratio   = (width < contentWidth) ? width / contentWidth : 1;

        $(this).removeAttr('style');
        caption.removeAttr('style');

        img.removeAttr('width');
        img.removeAttr('height');
        img.css('max-width', "100%");
        img.css('height', "auto");

        $(this).css('max-width', (ratio * 100.0) + '%');
    })
});

				<a href="http://www.cam.ac.uk" class="campl-main-logo">

			<div class="campl-column2">
				
				<div class="campl-site-search" id="site-search-btn">
    <label for="header-search" class="hidden">Search site</label>
    <div class="campl-search-input">
      <form action="https://search.cam.ac.uk/web">
      
        <input id="header-search" type="text" placeholder="Search" name="query" size="18" title="Search Site" class="text search-autocomplete" /><input type="image" class="campl-search-submit " src="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/++theme++ucam.falcon/light/images/interface/btn-search-header.png" /><input type="hidden" value="HPS" name="inst" /></form>
    </div>
  </div>
			</div>
		</div>		
	</div><div class="campl-row campl-global-header campl-search-drawer">
		<div class="campl-wrap clearfix">
			<form class="campl-site-search-form" id="site-search-container" action="https://search.cam.ac.uk/web">
    <div class="campl-search-form-wrapper clearfix">
      <input id="header-search" type="text" placeholder="Search" name="query" size="18" title="Search Site" class="text search-autocomplete" /><input type="image" class="campl-search-submit " src="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/++theme++ucam.falcon/light/images/interface/btn-search-header.png" /><input type="hidden" value="HPS" name="inst" /></div>
  </form>
    <script type="text/javascript">
        /* there are two auto-completion plugins and the wrong one wins.
         * Create the jQuery UI widget *directly* by instanciating a widget 
         * for each object manually, adding it to the element data.
         */
        var widget = $.ui.autocomplete,
            fullname = 'ui-autocomplete',
            search_inst = $('#site-search-btn input[type=hidden][name=inst]').val(),
            options = {
                source: function(request, response) {
                    $.ajax({
                        url: "http://api.search.cam.ac.uk/suggest",
                        dataType: "jsonp",
                        data: { term: request.term, inst: search_inst },
                        success: response
                    })
                },
                select: function(event, ui) {
                    // Submit the form on select
                    $(this).val(ui.item.value);
                    $(this).context.form.submit();
                }
            };
        /* NB: Following jQuery selector matches mobile AND desktop views */
        $("input.search-autocomplete").each(function () {
            var instance = $.data(this, fullname, new widget(options, this));
        });
    </script>
		</div>
	</div>

                <div class="">

                    

                    

    <dl class="portalMessage info" id="kssPortalMessage" style="display:none"><dt>Info</dt>
        <dd></dd>
    </dl><div id="content">

                            

                            

                             <div id="viewlet-above-content-title">


</div>
                             
                                 
                                 
            
                
            
            
        
                             
                             <div id="viewlet-below-content-title">
</div>

                             
                                 
                                 
            
                
            
            
        
                             

                             <div id="viewlet-above-content-body">



</div>
                             <div id="content-core">
                                 
    
        
        <div class="" id="parent-fieldname-text-7aa6ac59219144ada06522adb1db2c08">
            <ul><li><a href="#applying">Applying</a></li>
<li><a href="#qualifications">Qualifications</a></li>
<li><a href="#study-mode">Study mode</a></li>
<li><a href="#further-information">Further information</a></li>
</ul><h2 id="applying">Applying</h2>
<h3>When should I apply?</h3>
<p>We will accept applications from <strong>4 September 2017</strong> for admission in October 2018.</p>
<p>The final deadline for applications is <strong>14 June 2018</strong> for the MPhil and <strong>28 June 2018</strong> for the PhD. It is not possible to apply after these dates.</p>
<p>However, it is likely that we will allocate all our places on the MPhil course before 14 June. If this happens we will close the admissions round early and it will not be possible to submit a new application. We therefore strongly recommend that MPhil applicants apply no later than <strong>15 February 2018</strong> to ensure that their application can be considered.</p>
<p>You will need to apply earlier than these dates if you wish to be considered for funding from certain schemes. See the table below:</p>
<table class="data" summary="Dates for submitting an MPhil or PhD application"><tbody><tr><td>4 September 2017</td>
<td>Graduate admissions open</td>
</tr><tr><td>11 October 2017</td>
<td><a title="" href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/graduate/funding#gates" class="internal-link" target="_self">Gates Cambridge</a> deadline (USA)</td>
</tr><tr><td>6 December 2017</td>
<td><a title="" href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/graduate/funding#gates" class="internal-link" target="_self">Gates Cambridge</a> deadline (other countries)<br /><a title="" href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/graduate/funding#trusts" class="internal-link" target="_self">Cambridge Trust</a> deadline<br /><a title="" href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/graduate/funding#ahrc" class="internal-link" target="_self">AHRC Doctoral Training Partnership and Master's Award</a> deadline</td>
</tr><tr><td>15 February 2018</td>
<td>Recommended deadline for all other MPhil applicants</td>
</tr><tr><td>14 June 2018</td>
<td>Final deadline for MPhil applicants</td>
</tr><tr><td>28 June 2018</td>
<td>Final deadline for PhD applicants</td>
</tr></tbody></table><p>All deadlines are <strong>12noon UK time</strong> on the date stated.</p>
<p>We receive a large number of applications each year, so <strong>early submission is advisable</strong>.</p>
<h3>Should I submit my CV (resumé)?</h3>
<p>Your CV is only required if you are applying for the Gates Cambridge Scholarship. It will not be seen by anyone in the Department.</p>
<h3>Is there an interview?</h3>
<p>Yes, admission is subject to an interview. The interview, with one or two senior members of the Department, can be conducted by phone or online if it is not practical for you to travel to Cambridge (unless the interview is for the part-time PhD, in which case it must be in person).</p>
<h3>Should I submit three academic references?</h3>
<p>No, we will not accept more than two academic references.</p>
<h2 id="qualifications">Qualifications</h2>
<h3>Can you tell me if I am sufficiently qualified to be admitted to the MPhil course?</h3>
<p>The best way for us to assess your suitability is for you to submit a complete application. We are unable to give you a preliminary assessment of the chances of your application being successful.</p>
<p>Our normal requirement is a first class honours degree from a university in the UK, or a degree of an equivalent standard from an overseas university.</p>
<p><span class="campl-icon campl-info-icon"><a class="external-link" href="http://www.graduate.study.cam.ac.uk/international-students/international-qualifications" target="_self" title="">Graduate Admissions: International qualifications</a></span></p>
<h3>Can I be admitted straight to PhD studies or do I have to complete the MPhil first?</h3>
<p>Applicants are not normally admitted as a PhD student unless they have completed either the MPhil or Part III course in the Department or a similar course at another university. If you apply for the PhD we may offer you a place on the MPhil course instead if we judge that it would be more appropriate for you.</p>
<h3>Do I need to take a Graduate Record Examination (GRE) test?</h3>
<p>No, this is not a requirement; we are unable to accept GRE test results.</p>
<h2 id="study-mode">Study mode</h2>
<h3>Can I study HPS as a part-time student?</h3>
<p>We offer a <a title="" href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/graduate/phd/part-time" class="internal-link" target="_self">part-time PhD</a>, but the MPhil can only be taken as a full-time course.</p>
<h3>Should I apply to start the PhD in Lent Term?</h3>
<p>Although it is possible to start the PhD in Lent Term (January), we strongly recommend that all PhD students should start in Michaelmas Term (October). Please note that you will not be eligible for any University funding if you start in Lent Term.</p>
<h3>Can I study by distance learning or online learning?</h3>
<p>No, we do not offer any distance learning or online learning courses.</p>
<h2 id="further-information">Further information</h2>
<h3>Where can I find information about the number of applicants?</h3>
<p><span class="campl-icon campl-info-icon"><a href="http://www.graduate.study.cam.ac.uk/admissions-statistics">Graduate Admissions: Admissions statistics</a></span></p>
<h3>Who should I contact if I have any other questions?</h3>
<p>Please <a title="" href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/about/contact" class="internal-link" target="_self">contact the Department</a>.</p>
            
        </div>

					<img alt="University of Cambridge" src="/++theme++ucam.falcon/light/images/interface/main-logo-small.png" /></a>
