			</div>
				
			<div class="campl-column2">
				
				<div class="campl-site-search" id="site-search-btn">
    <label for="header-search" class="hidden">Search site</label>
    <div class="campl-search-input">
      <form action="https://search.cam.ac.uk/web">
      
        <input id="header-search" type="text" placeholder="Search" name="query" size="18" title="Search Site" class="text search-autocomplete" /><input type="image" class="campl-search-submit " src="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/++theme++ucam.falcon/light/images/interface/btn-search-header.png" /><input type="hidden" value="HPS" name="inst" /></form>
    </div>
  </div>
			</div>
		</div>		
	</div><div class="campl-row campl-global-header campl-search-drawer">
		<div class="campl-wrap clearfix">
			<form class="campl-site-search-form" id="site-search-container" action="https://search.cam.ac.uk/web">
    <div class="campl-search-form-wrapper clearfix">
      <input id="header-search" type="text" placeholder="Search" name="query" size="18" title="Search Site" class="text search-autocomplete" /><input type="image" class="campl-search-submit " src="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/++theme++ucam.falcon/light/images/interface/btn-search-header.png" /><input type="hidden" value="HPS" name="inst" /></div>
  </form>
    <script type="text/javascript">
        /* there are two auto-completion plugins and the wrong one wins.
         * Create the jQuery UI widget *directly* by instanciating a widget 
         * for each object manually, adding it to the element data.
         */
        var widget = $.ui.autocomplete,
            fullname = 'ui-autocomplete',
            search_inst = $('#site-search-btn input[type=hidden][name=inst]').val(),
            options = {
                source: function(request, response) {
                    $.ajax({
                        url: "http://api.search.cam.ac.uk/suggest",
                        dataType: "jsonp",
                        data: { term: request.term, inst: search_inst },
                        success: response
                    })
                },
                select: function(event, ui) {
                    // Submit the form on select
                    $(this).val(ui.item.value);
                    $(this).context.form.submit();
                }
            };
        /* NB: Following jQuery selector matches mobile AND desktop views */
        $("input.search-autocomplete").each(function () {
            var instance = $.data(this, fullname, new widget(options, this));
        });
    </script>
		</div>
	</div>

				<div class="campl-content-container">
					<h1 class="campl-sub-title">
                    Funding for graduate students
                </h1>
				</div>
			</div>
		</div>
	</div><div class="campl-row campl-content campl-recessed-content">
			<div class="campl-wrap clearfix">
				<div class="campl-column3">
					
  <div class="campl-tertiary-navigation">
    <div class="campl-tertiary-navigation-structure">
      <ul class="campl-unstyled-list campl-vertical-breadcrumb"><li><a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk" title="Department of History and Philosophy of Science">

            <span class="campl-vertical-breadcrumb-indicator"></span>
        </a></li>
        
          <li>
            <a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study" class="campl-parent-page" title="Study HPS">
              Study HPS
              <span class="campl-vertical-breadcrumb-indicator"></span>

				<div class="campl-column6  campl-main-content" id="campl-content"><div class="clearfix campl-carousel" id="campl-carousel">
        
          <div class="campl-carousel-container">
            <ul class="campl-unstyled-list campl-slides"><li class="campl-slide campl-column12">
  <div class="image-container">
    
      <img alt="slide-6601.jpg" class="campl-scale-with-grid" src="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/images/carousel/slide-6601/@@images/f4dde20a-8019-472b-9258-d5f377becd43.jpeg" title="Foraminifera slide from Charles Elcock microscope slide collection, 1872–1910.             <div id="viewlet-above-content">
</div>

            
                <div class="">

                    

                    

    <dl class="portalMessage info" id="kssPortalMessage" style="display:none"><dt>Info</dt>
        <dd></dd>
    </dl><div id="content">

                            

                            

                             <div id="viewlet-above-content-title">


</div>
                             
                                 
                                 
            
                
            
            
        
                             
                             <div id="viewlet-below-content-title">
</div>

                             
                                 
                                 
            
                
            
            
        
                             

                             <div id="viewlet-above-content-body">



</div>
                             <div id="content-core">
                                 
    
        
        <div class="" id="parent-fieldname-text-d7cf982eb9c24b47a8ed9bdd91ceb9df">
            <p class="first">Some options for obtaining funding are given on this page. See <a href="http://www.student-funding.cam.ac.uk/">Cambridge Funding Search</a> for details of other awards that are available.</p>
<p>We recommend that you apply for all funding for which you are eligible. Do not wait for the outcome of one application before submitting other applications.</p>
<p>Please note that the Department has no general funds to help students meet the costs of fees and maintenance.</p>
<ul><li><a href="#ahrc">Arts and Humanities Research Council</a></li>
<li><a href="#trusts">Cambridge Trust</a></li>
<li><a href="#college">College Studentships</a></li>
<li><a href="#gates">Gates Cambridge Scholarships</a></li>
<li><a href="#rwl">Rausing, Williamson and Lipton Studentships</a></li>
<li><a href="#wellcome">Wellcome Trust Awards in Medical Humanities</a></li>
<li><a href="#other">Other sources of funding</a></li>
</ul><h2 id="ahrc">Arts and Humanities Research Council</h2>
<p>The AHRC offers awards to students from the UK and European Union. A full studentship, which covers all fees and a maintenance allowance, is offered to those meeting UK residency criteria; EU nationals are eligible for a fees-only award.</p>
<h3>AHRC Doctoral Training Partnership</h3>
<p>To be eligible for an AHRC Doctoral Award you must submit your PhD application by <strong>6 December 2017</strong>. Make sure you complete the AHRC section in the Applicant Portal. No additional documents are required.</p>
<p><span class="campl-icon campl-info-icon"><a href="http://www.ahrcdtp.csah.cam.ac.uk/information-prospective-students/ahrc-studentships">Further information about AHRC studentships</a></span></p>
<h3>AHRC Master's Awards</h3>
<p>To be considered for an AHRC Master's Award you must indicate in the funding application section of the Applicant Portal that you wish to be considered for funding, and you must submit your MPhil application by <strong>6 December 2017</strong>. No additional documents are required.</p>
<h2 id="trusts">Cambridge Trust</h2>
<p>The Cambridge Commonwealth, European and International Trust offers scholarships to students from overseas, the European Union and the UK for MPhil and PhD study. These include the Cambridge International Scholarship (for overseas PhD students), the Vice-Chancellor's Awards (for PhD students from the UK and EU) and the Newton &amp; College Scholarship (for UK MPhil students).</p>
<p>To apply for Cambridge Trust funding you must indicate in the funding application section of the Applicant Portal that you wish to be considered for funding. Some scholarships offered by the Cambridge Trust require you to make an additional application: see the Trust's website for details.</p>
<p>You must submit your MPhil or PhD application by <strong>6 December 2017</strong> to be eligible for Cambridge Trust funding.</p>
<p><span class="campl-icon campl-info-icon"><a href="http://www.cambridgetrust.org/" title="Cambridge Trust">Cambridge Trust</a></span></p>
<h2 id="college">College Studentships</h2>
<p>The Colleges offer some studentships to their own students or to applicants who select that College as their first choice. See <a href="http://www.student-funding.cam.ac.uk/">Cambridge Funding Search</a> or <a href="http://map.cam.ac.uk/colleges">each College's website</a> to find out what is available.</p>
<h2 id="gates">Gates Cambridge Scholarships</h2>
<p>The Gates Cambridge Trust offers scholarships to students from overseas and the European Union (excluding the UK) for MPhil and PhD study.</p>
<p>To apply, complete the funding application section of the Applicant Portal, including a 500-word personal statement. You must also submit a personal reference.</p>
<p>You will need to submit your MPhil or PhD application earlier than the usual deadline to be eligible for a Gates Cambridge Scholarship. The deadline for US citizens normally resident in the USA is <strong>11 October 2017</strong>; for citizens of all other countries (except the UK) and US citizens normally resident outside the USA (including current MPhil students applying to continue to the PhD) the deadline is <strong>6 December 2017</strong>.</p>
<p><span class="campl-icon campl-info-icon"><a href="http://www.gatescambridge.org/" title="Gates Cambridge">Gates Cambridge</a></span></p>
<h2 id="rwl">Rausing, Williamson and Lipton Studentships</h2>
<p>The Department of History and Philosophy of Science will automatically consider all applicants for graduate studies in HPS for trust fund maintenance awards. Assessment will be based on information provided in the Applicant Portal. The number of awards made in any year will be conditional on previous commitments and income generated by the fund. Initial offers of funding will be made in February each year, and awards will continue to be allocated until the application deadline has been reached, or all the available funding has been committed.</p>
<h2 id="wellcome">Wellcome Trust Awards in Medical Humanities</h2>
<h3 id="w_masters">Wellcome Master's Awards</h3>
<p>The University is able to put forward one candidate each year for a Wellcome Master's award. Awards pay a stipend and all compulsory University and College fees at the UK home graduate student level only. Applicants should have a minimum of an excellent upper second class honours degree (or equivalent) in a relevant subject.</p>
<p>Funded students will be expected to write two essays and the dissertation in history, philosophy or ethics of medicine, broadly understood to include life sciences and public health. Strong preference is given to applicants intending to go on to a PhD in this area.</p>
<p>The Department is responsible for nominations. Applicants should indicate their interest in an award by entering 'Wellcome Master's Award' in the funding application section of the Applicant Portal.</p>
<p><span class="campl-icon campl-info-icon"><a href="https://wellcome.ac.uk/funding/masters-awards-humanities-and-social-science" title="Wellcome Trust">Further information about Wellcome Master's Awards</a></span></p>
<h3 id="w_doctoral">Wellcome Doctoral Studentships</h3>
<p>Awards pay a stipend, a set amount to cover conference travel, research expenses and, where justified, the cost of overseas fieldwork travel, as well as all compulsory University and College fees at the UK home graduate student level. Fees at the overseas rate will not be provided. Awards enable scholars to undertake up to three years of full-time research on a history, philosophy or ethics of medicine topic leading to a doctoral degree. Strong preference is given to applicants intending to make a long-term academic career in the subject.</p>
<p>Applicants should hold a Master's in medical humanities or a Master's with strong emphasis on medical humanities. (If specialist language skills are essential to undertake the research, a Master's in the language required may be acceptable.) The proposed project must fall within the history, philosophy or ethics of medicine, broadly understood. If you are not sure whether or not your interest falls within the scheme, you are strongly advised to discuss it with a prospective supervisor. The application must be sponsored by a senior member of the Department, who would supervise the student if an award were made, and must be submitted through the Department. Prospective applicants should note that only a very small number of doctoral studentships is awarded each year and that competition for them is intense.</p>
<p>The Department is responsible for nominating applicants. If you would like to be nominated, <strong>please contact the Department no later than 4 January 2018</strong> and enter 'Wellcome Doctoral Studentship' in the funding application section of the Applicant Portal.</p>
<p><span class="campl-icon campl-info-icon"><a href="https://wellcome.ac.uk/funding/doctoral-studentships" title="Wellcome Trust">Further information about Wellcome Doctoral Studentships</a></span></p>
<h2 id="other">Other sources of funding</h2>
<h3>British Society for the Philosophy of Science</h3>
<p>The <a href="http://www.thebsps.org/" title="British Society for the Philosophy of Science">British Society for the Philosophy of Science</a> offers one PhD scholarship each year.</p>
<h3>British Society for the History of Science</h3>
<p>The <a href="http://www.bshs.org.uk/" title="British Society for the History of Science">British Society for the History of Science</a> offers up to four bursaries each year to support students taking a master's degree.</p>
<h3>Cambridge Philosophical Society</h3>
<p>The <a href="http://www.cambridgephilosophicalsociety.org/" title="Cambridge Philosophical Society">Cambridge Philosophical Society</a> awards research studentships, either to provide for the continuation of an exceptionally promising piece of research beyond the usual standard of the PhD, or to allow extra time for the completion of a PhD thesis which has been delayed by circumstances outside the applicant's control. Applicants must be fellows of the Society of at least one year's standing.</p>
<h3>Royal Historical Society</h3>
<p>The <a href="http://www.royalhistoricalsociety.org/" title="Royal Historical Society">Royal Historical Society</a> offers a number of research grants for those undertaking postgraduate research. Funds are available to subsidise attendance at conferences and training courses, and to help defray the costs of archival visits.</p>

<h3>PhD Completion Grants</h3>
<p>The Department of History and Philosophy of Science will consider applications for PhD completion grants of up to £2,500 from PhD students registered in the Department. Students should apply by 1 October, just before they start their 10th term, providing a PhD submission plan that includes an outline of the thesis and estimated completion date. The application should also include a letter of support from the PhD supervisor.</p>
<h3>John Forrester and Lisa Appignanesi Travel and Research Expenses Fund</h3>
<p>Graduate students in the Department can apply for travel or research expenses grants of up to £150 a year to help with the cost of conducting research on their dissertation. These travel grants are primarily aimed at PhD students but are sometimes available to support MPhil students. <a title="" href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/about/contact" class="internal-link" target="_self">Please send an email</a> to the Department's administrative staff – in advance of any financial commitment being made – to ask for permission to use these funds. Once you have received confirmation you can claim reimbursement by submitting an expenses claim form with receipts. Funding for research expenses and/or travel is sometimes available through Colleges, so students should check with their College before applying for this funding.</p>
<h3 id="travel">Conference Travel Grants</h3>
<p>Graduate students in the Department can apply for up to £150 a year to help with the cost of travel to conferences where they are giving a paper (not for attendance only). These travel grants are primarily aimed at PhD students but are sometimes available to support MPhil students. <a title="" href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/about/contact" class="internal-link" target="_self">Please send an email</a> to the Department's administrative staff in advance of the conference to ask for permission to use these funds. Once you have received confirmation you can claim reimbursement by submitting an expenses claim form with receipts. Funding for conferences is sometimes available through Colleges, so students should check with their College before drawing on this funding.</p>
<h3>Hardship</h3>
<p>Students experiencing hardship should consult their College tutor for advice about sources of funding for which they may be eligible. In addition, the Student Registry administers research awards for PhD students who experience hardship as a result of unforeseen changes in their financial circumstances.</p>
<p><span class="campl-icon campl-info-icon"><a href="http://www.cambridgestudents.cam.ac.uk/fees-and-funding/financial-hardship-support-access-funds/hardship-funding">Student Registry: Hardship funding for graduate students</a></span></p>
<p>Managers of the Department's Williamson, Rausing and Lipton Trust Funds are willing to consider applications out of cycle from genuine hardship cases, as long as the applicant can demonstrate that they have approached all other available sources.</p>
<p class="footer-caption">Main image: Foraminifera slide from Charles Elcock microscope slide collection, 1872–1910. Foraminifera are single-celled aquatic microorganisms with protective shells, here arranged and mounted according to type. (Wh.6601)<br />Image credit: Whipple Museum of the History of Science, University of Cambridge</p>

$(document).ready(function(){
    var contentWidth = $('#content').width();

    $("dl.image-inline.captioned, dl.image-left.captioned, dl.image-right.captioned").each(function() {
        var caption = $(this).find('.image-caption');
        var img     = $(this).find('img');
        var width   = img.width()
        var ratio   = (width < contentWidth) ? width / contentWidth : 1;

        $(this).removeAttr('style');
        caption.removeAttr('style');

        img.removeAttr('width');
        img.removeAttr('height');
        img.css('max-width', "100%");
        img.css('height', "auto");

        $(this).css('max-width', (ratio * 100.0) + '%');
    })
});

      <input id="header-search" type="text" placeholder="Search" name="query" size="18" title="Search Site" class="text search-autocomplete" /><input type="image" class="campl-search-submit " src="https://www.hms.hps.cam.ac.uk/++theme++ucam.falcon/light/images/interface/btn-search-header.png" /></div>

    <script type="text/javascript">
        /* there are two auto-completion plugins and the wrong one wins.
         * Create the jQuery UI widget *directly* by instanciating a widget 
         * for each object manually, adding it to the element data.
         */
        var widget = $.ui.autocomplete,
            fullname = 'ui-autocomplete',
            search_inst = $('#site-search-btn input[type=hidden][name=inst]').val(),
            options = {
                source: function(request, response) {
                    $.ajax({
                        url: "http://api.search.cam.ac.uk/suggest",
                        dataType: "jsonp",
                        data: { term: request.term, inst: search_inst },
                        success: response
                    })
                },
                select: function(event, ui) {
                    // Submit the form on select
                    $(this).val(ui.item.value);
                    $(this).context.form.submit();
                }
            };
        /* NB: Following jQuery selector matches mobile AND desktop views */
        $("input.search-autocomplete").each(function () {
            var instance = $.data(this, fullname, new widget(options, this));
        });
    </script>
		</div>

		<div class="campl-wrap clearfix">
			<div class="campl-column6 campl-main-content">
  
  
    <div class="campl-content-container campl-sub-column-right-border clearfix">
      
  <div class="campl-teaser campl-horizontal-teaser clearfix">
    
    <div class="campl-column6">
      <div class="campl-content-container campl-horizontal-teaser-img">
        <a href="https://www.hms.hps.cam.ac.uk/about" class="campl-teaser-img-link">
            
            
            <img class="campl-scale-with-grid" src="https://www.hms.hps.cam.ac.uk/images/t1/@@images/65baa517-e6ad-45f1-85f9-a07699ba9bb1.jpeg" alt="T1" /></a>
      </div>

    <div class="campl-column6">
      <div class="campl-content-container campl-horizontal-teaser-txt">
        <h3 class="campl-teaser-title"><a href="https://www.hms.hps.cam.ac.uk/about">About the course</a></h3>
        <p>Welcome to the MPhil in Health, Medicine and Society at the University of Cambridge. This course offers a uniquely interdisciplinary approach to teaching and research, combining world class faculty with outstanding institutional resources. In addition to history, sociology and social anthropology, the course includes ethics and philosophy, thus offering an unparalleled educational experience.</p>
        
          <a class="campl-primary-cta" href="https://www.hms.hps.cam.ac.uk/about">Read more</a>
          
        
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>


      
    </div>
    
    <hr class="campl-teaser-divider" /><div class="campl-content-container campl-sub-column-right-border campl-vertical-padding clearfix">
      <div class="campl-column6">
        <div class="campl-content-container campl-side-padding">
          
  <div class="campl-teaser campl-vertical-teaser">

      </div>
    
    
    
      <div class="campl-content-container campl-vertical-teaser-txt">

        <p>Information on the modules taught on this course.</p>
        
          <a class="campl-primary-cta" href="https://www.hms.hps.cam.ac.uk/current-students/teaching">Read more</a>

$(document).ready(function(){
    var contentWidth = $('#content').width();

    $("dl.image-inline.captioned, dl.image-left.captioned, dl.image-right.captioned").each(function() {
        var caption = $(this).find('.image-caption');
        var img     = $(this).find('img');
        var width   = img.width()
        var ratio   = (width < contentWidth) ? width / contentWidth : 1;

        $(this).removeAttr('style');
        caption.removeAttr('style');

        img.removeAttr('width');
        img.removeAttr('height');
        img.css('max-width', "100%");
        img.css('height', "auto");

        $(this).css('max-width', (ratio * 100.0) + '%');
    })
});
</script><div id="viewlet-cookiepolicy" style="display:none">

you use our web site. We may also use external analysis systems which may
set additional cookies to perform their analysis.These cookies (and any
others in use) are detailed in our site privacy and cookie policies and are
integral to our web site.  You can delete or disable these cookies in your
web browser if you wish but then our site may not work correctly.</p>

    <div class="campl-search-form-wrapper clearfix">
      <input id="header-search" type="text" placeholder="Search" name="query" size="18" title="Search Site" class="text search-autocomplete" /><input type="image" class="campl-search-submit " src="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/++theme++ucam.falcon/light/images/interface/btn-search-header.png" /><input type="hidden" value="HPS" name="inst" /></div>
  </form>
    <script type="text/javascript">
        /* there are two auto-completion plugins and the wrong one wins.
         * Create the jQuery UI widget *directly* by instanciating a widget 
         * for each object manually, adding it to the element data.
         */
        var widget = $.ui.autocomplete,
            fullname = 'ui-autocomplete',
            search_inst = $('#site-search-btn input[type=hidden][name=inst]').val(),
            options = {
                source: function(request, response) {
                    $.ajax({
                        url: "http://api.search.cam.ac.uk/suggest",
                        dataType: "jsonp",
                        data: { term: request.term, inst: search_inst },
                        success: response
                    })
                },
                select: function(event, ui) {
                    // Submit the form on select
                    $(this).val(ui.item.value);
                    $(this).context.form.submit();
                }
            };
        /* NB: Following jQuery selector matches mobile AND desktop views */
        $("input.search-autocomplete").each(function () {
            var instance = $.data(this, fullname, new widget(options, this));
        });
    </script>
		</div>
	</div>
		<div class="campl-row campl-global-navigation-drawer">

			<div class="campl-column3 campl-spacing-column">

			<div class="campl-column9">
				<div class="campl-content-container">
					<h1 class="campl-sub-title">
                    MPhil in History and Philosophy of Science and Medicine
                </h1>
				</div>
			</div>
		</div>
	</div><div class="campl-row campl-content campl-recessed-content">
			<div class="campl-wrap clearfix">
				<div class="campl-column3">
					
  <div class="campl-tertiary-navigation">
    <div class="campl-tertiary-navigation-structure">
      <ul class="campl-unstyled-list campl-vertical-breadcrumb"><li><a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk" title="Department of History and Philosophy of Science">
            Department of History and Philosophy of Science
            <span class="campl-vertical-breadcrumb-indicator"></span>
        </a></li>
        
          <li>
            <a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study" class="campl-parent-page" title="Study HPS">
              Study HPS
              <span class="campl-vertical-breadcrumb-indicator"></span>
            </a>
          </li>
        
      </ul><ul class="campl-unstyled-list campl-vertical-breadcrumb-navigation"><li class="navTreeItem visualNoMarker navTreeFolderish"><a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/undergraduate"><span>Undergraduate study</span></a>

				<div class="campl-column6  campl-main-content" id="campl-content"><div class="clearfix campl-carousel" id="campl-carousel">
        
          <div class="campl-carousel-container">
            <ul class="campl-unstyled-list campl-slides"><li class="campl-slide campl-column12">
  <div class="image-container">
    
      <img alt="darwin-origin.jpg" class="campl-scale-with-grid" src="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/images/carousel/darwin-origin/@@images/0f474419-40bb-44b3-8bc9-8ce49b4493b5.jpeg" title="Six editions of Charles Darwin's 'Origin of Species' (Image credit: Wellcome Library, London)" /></div>
  

</li>
            </ul></div>
        
      </div><div class="campl-content-container">

            <div id="viewlet-above-content">
</div>

            
                <div class="">

                    

                    

    <dl class="portalMessage info" id="kssPortalMessage" style="display:none"><dt>Info</dt>
        <dd></dd>
    </dl><div id="content">

                            

                            

                             <div id="viewlet-above-content-title">


</div>
                             
                                 
                                 
            
                
            
            
        
                             
                             <div id="viewlet-below-content-title">
</div>

                             
                                 
                                 
            
                
            
            
        
                             

                             <div id="viewlet-above-content-body">



</div>
                             <div id="content-core">
                                 
    
        
        <div class="" id="parent-fieldname-text-53d4b71d682040b8ae0cb4d468da7dbb">
            <p class="first">Our MPhil provides students with an unparalleled opportunity to explore topics across history and philosophy of science and medicine, laying deep foundations for further study, work and public involvement.</p>
<p>Coming to Cambridge from all over the world and with very diverse backgrounds, students discover our Department to cover the depth and breadth of this large research area spanning centuries, cultures and sciences. They get to work closely with leading academics in the Department and the University at large. The sheer number and diversity of potential supervisors means that students can find experts on most areas of history and philosophy of science and medicine. These experts then work with each student individually, guiding them in honing their research topics, finding the right literature to engage, formulating an argument, and perfecting their writing.</p>
<p>There is a great deal of flexibility about the topics of the essays and the dissertation. This room for independent growth in different directions regularly gathers praise from our students and distinguishes our programme from those at other universities. There are no courses or modules to complete, all assessment is based on submitted writing. Some students come with a specific list of topics and work on them throughout the year, others adjust or completely change their plans. Some specialise right away in either history (of a period or of a science), or philosophy. Others mix and match, trying out different skills in each piece of submitted work. Many of our students research objects in the Whipple Museum of History of Science, making discoveries and publishing their work afterwards.</p>
<p>Whatever their path, students interact with members of the Department – academics, PhD students, postdocs, visitors – in an intense and packed schedule of talks, lectures, seminars, reading groups and supervisions. In these interactions students get a great deal of feedback on their writing and acquire a broad set of skills for how to be an academic researcher, writer and colleague. The 15,000-word dissertation is the culmination of the year. It allows students to explore a topic in depth and to build an extended argument. This piece of work, closely and thoroughly guided by a specially appointed and supremely qualified supervisor, often becomes the basis of a PhD thesis or academic article. By the end of their time in our programme, students have a good idea about their own future interests and the best way to realise their individual talents and newly acquired skills either within our field or outside it.</p>
<div class="info-box-full">
<h2 style="padding-top: 0; ">Part III</h2>
<p>If you are currently a Cambridge undergraduate student you may want to apply to take the <a title="" href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/undergraduate/partiii" class="internal-link" target="_self">HPS Part III</a> course rather than the MPhil. However, you can apply for the MPhil if you prefer, or you can apply for both and decide later which course to take.</p>
</div>
<p class="footer-caption">Main image: Six editions of Charles Darwin's <em>Origin of Species</em><br />Image credit: Wellcome Library, London</p>
            
        </div>
    
    

                             </div>
                             <div id="viewlet-below-content-body">





    <div class="visualClear"><!-- --></div>

    <div class="documentActions">
        

        

    </div>

</div>

                            
                        </div>
                    

                    
                </div>
            

            <div id="viewlet-below-content">





</div>
        </div></div>
				<div class="campl-column3 campl-secondary-content">
            
                
<div class="portletWrapper" data-portlethash="706c6f6e652e7269676874636f6c756d6e0a636f6e746578740a2f4850534d41494e2f73747564792f67726164756174652f6d7068696c2d6870736d2f6d7068696c2d6870736d2d6f766572766965770a6d6f72652d61626f75742d7468652d6d7068696c" id="portletwrapper-706c6f6e652e7269676874636f6c756d6e0a636f6e746578740a2f4850534d41494e2f73747564792f67726164756174652f6d7068696c2d6870736d2f6d7068696c2d6870736d2d6f766572766965770a6d6f72652d61626f75742d7468652d6d7068696c"><div class="campl-content-container falcon-linkbox-portlet">
    <div class="campl-heading-container">
        <h2>More about the MPhil</h2>
        
    </div>
    <ul class="campl-unstyled-list campl-related-links"><li><a href="http://www.graduate.study.cam.ac.uk/courses/directory/hphpmpstm">Overview</a></li>
        <li><a href="http://www.graduate.study.cam.ac.uk/courses/directory/hphpmpstm/study">Study</a></li>
        <li><a href="http://www.graduate.study.cam.ac.uk/courses/directory/hphpmpstm/requirements">Requirements</a></li>
        <li><a href="http://www.graduate.study.cam.ac.uk/courses/directory/hphpmpstm/finance">Finance</a></li>
        <li><a href="http://www.graduate.study.cam.ac.uk/courses/directory/hphpmpstm/apply">How to apply</a></li>
        
    </ul></div>
</div>

<div class="portletWrapper" data-portlethash="706c6f6e652e7269676874636f6c756d6e0a636f6e746578740a2f4850534d41494e2f73747564792f67726164756174652f6d7068696c2d6870736d2f6d7068696c2d6870736d2d6f766572766965770a666f722d63757272656e742d6d7068696c2d73747564656e7473" id="portletwrapper-706c6f6e652e7269676874636f6c756d6e0a636f6e746578740a2f4850534d41494e2f73747564792f67726164756174652f6d7068696c2d6870736d2f6d7068696c2d6870736d2d6f766572766965770a666f722d63757272656e742d6d7068696c2d73747564656e7473"><div class="campl-content-container falcon-linkbox-portlet">
    <div class="campl-heading-container">
        <h2>For current MPhil students</h2>
        
    </div>
    <ul class="campl-unstyled-list campl-related-links"><li><a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/students/mphil-guide">MPhil students' guide</a></li>

$(document).ready(function(){
    var contentWidth = $('#content').width();

    $("dl.image-inline.captioned, dl.image-left.captioned, dl.image-right.captioned").each(function() {
        var caption = $(this).find('.image-caption');
        var img     = $(this).find('img');
        var width   = img.width()
        var ratio   = (width < contentWidth) ? width / contentWidth : 1;

        $(this).removeAttr('style');
        caption.removeAttr('style');

        img.removeAttr('width');
        img.removeAttr('height');
        img.css('max-width', "100%");
        img.css('height', "auto");

        $(this).css('max-width', (ratio * 100.0) + '%');
    })
});

    <label for="header-search" class="hidden">Search site</label>
    <div class="campl-search-input">
      <form action="https://search.cam.ac.uk/web">
      
        <input id="header-search" type="text" placeholder="Search" name="query" size="18" title="Search Site" class="text search-autocomplete" /><input type="image" class="campl-search-submit " src="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/++theme++ucam.falcon/light/images/interface/btn-search-header.png" /><input type="hidden" value="HPS" name="inst" /></form>

		<div class="campl-wrap clearfix">
			<form class="campl-site-search-form" id="site-search-container" action="https://search.cam.ac.uk/web">
    <div class="campl-search-form-wrapper clearfix">
      <input id="header-search" type="text" placeholder="Search" name="query" size="18" title="Search Site" class="text search-autocomplete" /><input type="image" class="campl-search-submit " src="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/++theme++ucam.falcon/light/images/interface/btn-search-header.png" /><input type="hidden" value="HPS" name="inst" /></div>
  </form>
    <script type="text/javascript">
        /* there are two auto-completion plugins and the wrong one wins.
         * Create the jQuery UI widget *directly* by instanciating a widget 
         * for each object manually, adding it to the element data.
         */
        var widget = $.ui.autocomplete,
            fullname = 'ui-autocomplete',
            search_inst = $('#site-search-btn input[type=hidden][name=inst]').val(),
            options = {
                source: function(request, response) {
                    $.ajax({
                        url: "http://api.search.cam.ac.uk/suggest",
                        dataType: "jsonp",
                        data: { term: request.term, inst: search_inst },
                        success: response
                    })
                },
                select: function(event, ui) {
                    // Submit the form on select
                    $(this).val(ui.item.value);
                    $(this).context.form.submit();
                }
            };
        /* NB: Following jQuery selector matches mobile AND desktop views */
        $("input.search-autocomplete").each(function () {
            var instance = $.data(this, fullname, new widget(options, this));
        });
    </script>
		</div>
	</div>
		<div class="campl-row campl-global-navigation-drawer">

		<div class="campl-wrap clearfix campl-page-sub-title campl-recessed-sub-title">
			<div class="campl-column3 campl-spacing-column">

			<div class="campl-column9">
				<div class="campl-content-container">
					<h1 class="campl-sub-title">
                    MPhil in History and Philosophy of Science and Medicine
                </h1>
				</div>
			</div>
		</div>
	</div><div class="campl-row campl-content campl-recessed-content">
			<div class="campl-wrap clearfix">
				<div class="campl-column3">
					
  <div class="campl-tertiary-navigation">
    <div class="campl-tertiary-navigation-structure">
      <ul class="campl-unstyled-list campl-vertical-breadcrumb"><li><a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk" title="Department of History and Philosophy of Science">
            Department of History and Philosophy of Science
            <span class="campl-vertical-breadcrumb-indicator"></span>
        </a></li>
        
          <li>
            <a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study" class="campl-parent-page" title="Study HPS">
              Study HPS
              <span class="campl-vertical-breadcrumb-indicator"></span>
            </a>
          </li>
        
      </ul><ul class="campl-unstyled-list campl-vertical-breadcrumb-navigation"><li class="navTreeItem visualNoMarker navTreeFolderish"><a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/undergraduate"><span>Undergraduate study</span></a>

				<div class="campl-column6  campl-main-content" id="campl-content"><div class="clearfix campl-carousel" id="campl-carousel">
        
          <div class="campl-carousel-container">
            <ul class="campl-unstyled-list campl-slides"><li class="campl-slide campl-column12">
  <div class="image-container">
    
      <img alt="darwin-origin.jpg" class="campl-scale-with-grid" src="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/images/carousel/darwin-origin/@@images/0f474419-40bb-44b3-8bc9-8ce49b4493b5.jpeg" title="Six editions of Charles Darwin's 'Origin of Species' (Image credit: Wellcome Library, London)" /></div>
  

</li>
            </ul></div>
        
      </div><div class="campl-content-container">

            <div id="viewlet-above-content">
</div>

            
                <div class="">

                    

                    

    <dl class="portalMessage info" id="kssPortalMessage" style="display:none"><dt>Info</dt>
        <dd></dd>
    </dl><div id="content">

                            

                            

                             <div id="viewlet-above-content-title">


</div>
                             
                                 
                                 
            
                
            
            
        
                             
                             <div id="viewlet-below-content-title">
</div>

                             
                                 
                                 
            
                
            
            
        
                             

                             <div id="viewlet-above-content-body">



</div>
                             <div id="content-core">
                                 
    
        
        <div class="" id="parent-fieldname-text-53d4b71d682040b8ae0cb4d468da7dbb">
            <p class="first">Our MPhil provides students with an unparalleled opportunity to explore topics across history and philosophy of science and medicine, laying deep foundations for further study, work and public involvement.</p>
<p>Coming to Cambridge from all over the world and with very diverse backgrounds, students discover our Department to cover the depth and breadth of this large research area spanning centuries, cultures and sciences. They get to work closely with leading academics in the Department and the University at large. The sheer number and diversity of potential supervisors means that students can find experts on most areas of history and philosophy of science and medicine. These experts then work with each student individually, guiding them in honing their research topics, finding the right literature to engage, formulating an argument, and perfecting their writing.</p>
<p>There is a great deal of flexibility about the topics of the essays and the dissertation. This room for independent growth in different directions regularly gathers praise from our students and distinguishes our programme from those at other universities. There are no courses or modules to complete, all assessment is based on submitted writing. Some students come with a specific list of topics and work on them throughout the year, others adjust or completely change their plans. Some specialise right away in either history (of a period or of a science), or philosophy. Others mix and match, trying out different skills in each piece of submitted work. Many of our students research objects in the Whipple Museum of History of Science, making discoveries and publishing their work afterwards.</p>
<p>Whatever their path, students interact with members of the Department – academics, PhD students, postdocs, visitors – in an intense and packed schedule of talks, lectures, seminars, reading groups and supervisions. In these interactions students get a great deal of feedback on their writing and acquire a broad set of skills for how to be an academic researcher, writer and colleague. The 15,000-word dissertation is the culmination of the year. It allows students to explore a topic in depth and to build an extended argument. This piece of work, closely and thoroughly guided by a specially appointed and supremely qualified supervisor, often becomes the basis of a PhD thesis or academic article. By the end of their time in our programme, students have a good idea about their own future interests and the best way to realise their individual talents and newly acquired skills either within our field or outside it.</p>
<div class="info-box-full">
<h2 style="padding-top: 0; ">Part III</h2>
<p>If you are currently a Cambridge undergraduate student you may want to apply to take the <a title="" href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/undergraduate/partiii" class="internal-link" target="_self">HPS Part III</a> course rather than the MPhil. However, you can apply for the MPhil if you prefer, or you can apply for both and decide later which course to take.</p>
</div>
<p class="footer-caption">Main image: Six editions of Charles Darwin's <em>Origin of Species</em><br />Image credit: Wellcome Library, London</p>
            
        </div>
    
    

                             </div>
                             <div id="viewlet-below-content-body">

    </div>

</div>

                            
                        </div>
                    

                    
                </div>
            

            <div id="viewlet-below-content">





</div>
        </div></div>
				<div class="campl-column3 campl-secondary-content">
            
                
<div class="portletWrapper" data-portlethash="706c6f6e652e7269676874636f6c756d6e0a636f6e746578740a2f4850534d41494e2f73747564792f67726164756174652f6d7068696c2d6870736d2f6d7068696c2d6870736d2d6f766572766965770a6d6f72652d61626f75742d7468652d6d7068696c" id="portletwrapper-706c6f6e652e7269676874636f6c756d6e0a636f6e746578740a2f4850534d41494e2f73747564792f67726164756174652f6d7068696c2d6870736d2f6d7068696c2d6870736d2d6f766572766965770a6d6f72652d61626f75742d7468652d6d7068696c"><div class="campl-content-container falcon-linkbox-portlet">
    <div class="campl-heading-container">
        <h2>More about the MPhil</h2>
        
    </div>
    <ul class="campl-unstyled-list campl-related-links"><li><a href="http://www.graduate.study.cam.ac.uk/courses/directory/hphpmpstm">Overview</a></li>
        <li><a href="http://www.graduate.study.cam.ac.uk/courses/directory/hphpmpstm/study">Study</a></li>
        <li><a href="http://www.graduate.study.cam.ac.uk/courses/directory/hphpmpstm/requirements">Requirements</a></li>
        <li><a href="http://www.graduate.study.cam.ac.uk/courses/directory/hphpmpstm/finance">Finance</a></li>
        <li><a href="http://www.graduate.study.cam.ac.uk/courses/directory/hphpmpstm/apply">How to apply</a></li>
        
    </ul></div>
</div>

<div class="portletWrapper" data-portlethash="706c6f6e652e7269676874636f6c756d6e0a636f6e746578740a2f4850534d41494e2f73747564792f67726164756174652f6d7068696c2d6870736d2f6d7068696c2d6870736d2d6f766572766965770a666f722d63757272656e742d6d7068696c2d73747564656e7473" id="portletwrapper-706c6f6e652e7269676874636f6c756d6e0a636f6e746578740a2f4850534d41494e2f73747564792f67726164756174652f6d7068696c2d6870736d2f6d7068696c2d6870736d2d6f766572766965770a666f722d63757272656e742d6d7068696c2d73747564656e7473"><div class="campl-content-container falcon-linkbox-portlet">
    <div class="campl-heading-container">
        <h2>For current MPhil students</h2>
        
    </div>
    <ul class="campl-unstyled-list campl-related-links"><li><a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/students/mphil-guide">MPhil students' guide</a></li>
        <li><a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/students/timetable/partiii-mphil">MPhil and Part III timetable</a></li>
        <li><a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/documents/students-guides/mphil-specification.pdf">Programme specification (PDF)</a></li>
        
    </ul></div>
</div>

<div class="portletWrapper" data-portlethash="706c6f6e652e7269676874636f6c756d6e0a636f6e746578740a2f4850534d41494e2f73747564792f67726164756174650a65752d7175657374696f6e732d616e642d616e7377657273" id="portletwrapper-706c6f6e652e7269676874636f6c756d6e0a636f6e746578740a2f4850534d41494e2f73747564792f67726164756174650a65752d7175657374696f6e732d616e642d616e7377657273">
  <div class="campl-content-container">

$(document).ready(function(){
    var contentWidth = $('#content').width();

    $("dl.image-inline.captioned, dl.image-left.captioned, dl.image-right.captioned").each(function() {
        var caption = $(this).find('.image-caption');
        var img     = $(this).find('img');
        var width   = img.width()
        var ratio   = (width < contentWidth) ? width / contentWidth : 1;

        $(this).removeAttr('style');
        caption.removeAttr('style');

        img.removeAttr('width');
        img.removeAttr('height');
        img.css('max-width', "100%");
        img.css('height', "auto");

        $(this).css('max-width', (ratio * 100.0) + '%');
    })
});
</script></body></html>

    <div class="campl-search-input">
      <form action="https://search.cam.ac.uk/web">
      
        <input id="header-search" type="text" placeholder="Search" name="query" size="18" title="Search Site" class="text search-autocomplete" /><input type="image" class="campl-search-submit " src="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/++theme++ucam.falcon/light/images/interface/btn-search-header.png" /><input type="hidden" value="HPS" name="inst" /></form>

			<form class="campl-site-search-form" id="site-search-container" action="https://search.cam.ac.uk/web">
    <div class="campl-search-form-wrapper clearfix">
      <input id="header-search" type="text" placeholder="Search" name="query" size="18" title="Search Site" class="text search-autocomplete" /><input type="image" class="campl-search-submit " src="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/++theme++ucam.falcon/light/images/interface/btn-search-header.png" /><input type="hidden" value="HPS" name="inst" /></div>
  </form>
    <script type="text/javascript">
        /* there are two auto-completion plugins and the wrong one wins.
         * Create the jQuery UI widget *directly* by instanciating a widget 
         * for each object manually, adding it to the element data.
         */
        var widget = $.ui.autocomplete,
            fullname = 'ui-autocomplete',
            search_inst = $('#site-search-btn input[type=hidden][name=inst]').val(),
            options = {
                source: function(request, response) {
                    $.ajax({
                        url: "http://api.search.cam.ac.uk/suggest",
                        dataType: "jsonp",
                        data: { term: request.term, inst: search_inst },
                        success: response
                    })
                },
                select: function(event, ui) {
                    // Submit the form on select
                    $(this).val(ui.item.value);
                    $(this).context.form.submit();
                }
            };
        /* NB: Following jQuery selector matches mobile AND desktop views */
        $("input.search-autocomplete").each(function () {
            var instance = $.data(this, fullname, new widget(options, this));
        });
    </script>
		</div>

		<div class="campl-wrap clearfix campl-page-sub-title campl-recessed-sub-title">
			<div class="campl-column3 campl-spacing-column">

			<div class="campl-column9">
				<div class="campl-content-container">
					<h1 class="campl-sub-title">
                    PhD in History and Philosophy of Science
                </h1>
				</div>
			</div>
		</div>
	</div><div class="campl-row campl-content campl-recessed-content">
			<div class="campl-wrap clearfix">
				<div class="campl-column3">
					
  <div class="campl-tertiary-navigation">
    <div class="campl-tertiary-navigation-structure">
      <ul class="campl-unstyled-list campl-vertical-breadcrumb"><li><a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk" title="Department of History and Philosophy of Science">
            Department of History and Philosophy of Science
            <span class="campl-vertical-breadcrumb-indicator"></span>
        </a></li>
        
          <li>
            <a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study" class="" title="Study HPS">
              Study HPS
              <span class="campl-vertical-breadcrumb-indicator"></span>
            </a>
          </li>
        
        
          <li>
            <a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/graduate" class="campl-parent-page" title="Graduate study">
              Graduate study
              <span class="campl-vertical-breadcrumb-indicator"></span>
            </a>
          </li>
        
      </ul><ul class="campl-unstyled-list campl-vertical-breadcrumb-navigation"><li class="navTreeItem visualNoMarker"><a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/graduate/why-cambridge"><span>Why study HPS at Cambridge?</span></a>
</li>
<li class="navTreeItem visualNoMarker navTreeFolderish"><a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/graduate/mphil-hpsm"><span>MPhil in History and Philosophy of Science and Medicine</span></a>
</li>
<li class="navTreeItem visualNoMarker"><a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/graduate/mphil-hms"><span>MPhil in Health, Medicine and Society</span></a>
</li>
<li class="navTreeItem visualNoMarker campl-selected navTreeFolderish"><a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/graduate/phd" class=" navTreeCurrentItem"><span>PhD in History and Philosophy of Science</span></a>
<ul class="campl-unstyled-list campl-vertical-breadcrumb-children navTree navTreeLevel1"><li class="navTreeItem visualNoMarker"><a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/graduate/phd/part-time"><span>Part-time PhD</span></a>
</li>
<li class="navTreeItem visualNoMarker"><a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/graduate/phd/placement-record"><span>PhD placement record</span></a>
</li>
</ul></li>
<li class="navTreeItem visualNoMarker"><a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/graduate/funding"><span>Funding for graduate students</span></a>
</li>
<li class="navTreeItem visualNoMarker"><a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/graduate/faqs"><span>Frequently asked questions</span></a>
</li>

      </ul></div>
  </div>

				</div>
				<div class="campl-column6  campl-main-content" id="campl-content"><div class="clearfix campl-carousel" id="campl-carousel">
        
          <div class="campl-carousel-container">
            <ul class="campl-unstyled-list campl-slides"><li class="campl-slide campl-column12">
  <div class="image-container">
    
      <img alt="mond-crocodile.jpg" class="campl-scale-with-grid" src="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/images/carousel/mond-crocodile/@@images/60949e36-4b6f-443b-9a71-4665d63566fa.jpeg" title="Crocodile carving by Eric Gill on the Mond Building, where there is work space for HPS PhD students" /></div>
  

</li>
            </ul></div>
        
      </div><div class="campl-content-container">

            <div id="viewlet-above-content">
</div>

            
                <div class="">

                    

                    

    <dl class="portalMessage info" id="kssPortalMessage" style="display:none"><dt>Info</dt>
        <dd></dd>
    </dl><div id="content">

                            

                            

                             <div id="viewlet-above-content-title">


</div>
                             
                                 
                                 
            
                
            
            
        
                             
                             <div id="viewlet-below-content-title">
</div>

                             
                                 
                                 
            
                
            
            
        
                             

                             <div id="viewlet-above-content-body">



</div>
                             <div id="content-core">
                                 
    
        
        <div class="" id="parent-fieldname-text-609efee690094494ad99269194d1eace">
            <p class="first">The substantial, focused and independent theses that students write in history and philosophy of science help shape the future of scholarship in many different ways; and contributing to the development of knowledge in the University of Cambridge is a particularly rich and rewarding experience.</p>
<p>Working closely with a doctoral supervisor and advisor (usually both from the Department of History and Philosophy of Science, sometimes from other departments in the University), students will have the benefit of expert guidance and close consultation with experienced researchers in articulating, developing and presenting their own research. Usually that means meeting several times a term, often to discuss an outline, consider research findings or go over a chapter. Consistent review and attentive feedback are integral to the supervisory relationship built up over time.</p>
<p>Most students will have considered the research profiles and international reputations of our Department members in preparing an application to undertake doctoral studies here (it is often good to contact individuals directly). But the academic and social perspectives offered by joining a thriving research community are also invaluable. With around 45 doctoral students at any one time, a strong cohort of MPhil and Part III students each year, and postdoctoral researchers as well as Teaching Officers, the intellectual life of the Department is exceptionally strong. Sometimes you might wonder when you'll get time for your research or writing, for life in Cambridge has its seasons. Thriving reading groups, working groups and seminars provide a focus and in some cases allow scope for students to help set the agenda and present their own work amongst peers. Latin Therapy, the Cabinet of Natural History, and the reading group in philosophy and history of physics provide just a few examples of the kind of groups that meet on a weekly or fortnightly basis. Students are also supported with close attention paid to methodological development, research skills and career advice throughout their studies.</p>
<p>Most PhD students move from taking advantage of the learning opportunities provided in Cambridge to developing their own teaching skills by supervising appropriate courses. Some might also contribute to research and displays oriented around the holdings of the Whipple Museum of the History of Science. Students are also encouraged to participate in professional conferences and begin publishing their work. The Department's Whipple Library is an unparalleled specialist library in history and philosophy of science and medicine, while the University Library and College and department libraries provide access to archival and documentary resources invaluable for research on the sciences; for some students these might provide as strong a reason as individual Department members for studying here. Funding support is excellent also; whether applying from a Cambridge Part III, MPhil or from elsewhere, candidates should prepare appropriately and note deadlines for scholarships such as Gates Cambridge, Cambridge Trust and AHRC. The Department also has some funds at its own disposal. In addition to offering Rausing and Williamson Studentships it offers financial support for student research (as do many Colleges).</p>
<div class="info-box-full">
<h2 style="padding-top: 0; ">Opportunities to gain teaching experience</h2>
<p>Cambridge offers PhD students unusually valuable teaching experience through the chance to give <a title="" href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/about/admin/supervisors" class="internal-link" target="_self">supervisions</a> (tutorials) for undergraduates taking History and Philosophy of Science courses. PhD students are paid by the Colleges for this service. The University and the Department provide training in supervising undergraduates.</p>
</div>
<p class="footer-caption">Main image: Crocodile carving by Eric Gill on the Mond Building, where there is work space for HPS PhD students</p>
            
        </div>
    
    

                             </div>

                </div>

<div class="portletWrapper" data-portlethash="706c6f6e652e7269676874636f6c756d6e0a636f6e746578740a2f4850534d41494e2f73747564792f67726164756174650a65752d7175657374696f6e732d616e642d616e7377657273" id="portletwrapper-706c6f6e652e7269676874636f6c756d6e0a636f6e746578740a2f4850534d41494e2f73747564792f67726164756174650a65752d7175657374696f6e732d616e642d616e7377657273">
  <div class="campl-content-container">
  <div class="campl-teaser campl-promo-teaser campl-vertical-teaser">
    <div class="campl-content-container campl-vertical-teaser-txt">

          <a href="http://www.eu.admin.cam.ac.uk/audiences/postgraduate-students">EU Questions and Answers</a></p>
    </div>
    
      <div class="campl-content-container campl-vertical-teaser-img">

            <img class="campl-scale-with-grid" src="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/images/right-column-teasers/eu-flag-teaser/@@images/e021650c-1c47-460d-9468-8d7e4bce09d8.jpeg" alt="eu-flag-teaser.jpg" /></a>
      </div>
    
    <div class="campl-content-container campl-vertical-teaser-txt clearfix">

		</div><div class="campl-row campl-local-footer" id="falcon-local-footer">
  <div class="campl-wrap clearfix">
    <div class="campl-column3 campl-footer-navigation">
    
      <div class="campl-content-container campl-navigation-list&#10;            falcon-linkbox-portlet">
  
    
    <h3>
      <a href="http://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/">Department of History and Philosophy of Science</a>
    </h3>
  

  <ul class="campl-unstyled-list"><li><a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/about/contact">Contact us</a></li>
        
        <li><a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/email-search">Email search</a></li>
        
        <li><a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/privacy-and-cookie-policies">Privacy and cookie policies</a></li>
        
  </ul></div>

      
    

</div>
    <div class="campl-column3 campl-footer-navigation">
    
      <div class="campl-content-container campl-navigation-list&#10;            falcon-linkbox-portlet">
  
    
    <h3>
      <a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study">Study History and Philosophy of Science</a>
    </h3>
  

  <ul class="campl-unstyled-list"><li><a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/undergraduate">Undergraduate study</a></li>
        
        <li><a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/graduate">Graduate study</a></li>
        
        <li><a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/graduate/phd/placement-record">PhD placement record</a></li>
        
  </ul></div>

      
    

</div>
    <div class="campl-column3 campl-footer-navigation">
    
      <div class="campl-content-container campl-navigation-list&#10;            falcon-linkbox-portlet">
  
    
    <h3>

$(document).ready(function(){
    var contentWidth = $('#content').width();

    $("dl.image-inline.captioned, dl.image-left.captioned, dl.image-right.captioned").each(function() {
        var caption = $(this).find('.image-caption');
        var img     = $(this).find('img');
        var width   = img.width()
        var ratio   = (width < contentWidth) ? width / contentWidth : 1;

        $(this).removeAttr('style');
        caption.removeAttr('style');

        img.removeAttr('width');
        img.removeAttr('height');
        img.css('max-width', "100%");
        img.css('height', "auto");

        $(this).css('max-width', (ratio * 100.0) + '%');
    })
});
</script></body></html>

        <input id="header-search" type="text" placeholder="Search" name="query" size="18" title="Search Site" class="text search-autocomplete" /><input type="image" class="campl-search-submit " src="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/++theme++ucam.falcon/light/images/interface/btn-search-header.png" /><input type="hidden" value="HPS" name="inst" /></form>

			<form class="campl-site-search-form" id="site-search-container" action="https://search.cam.ac.uk/web">
    <div class="campl-search-form-wrapper clearfix">
      <input id="header-search" type="text" placeholder="Search" name="query" size="18" title="Search Site" class="text search-autocomplete" /><input type="image" class="campl-search-submit " src="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/++theme++ucam.falcon/light/images/interface/btn-search-header.png" /><input type="hidden" value="HPS" name="inst" /></div>
  </form>
    <script type="text/javascript">
        /* there are two auto-completion plugins and the wrong one wins.
         * Create the jQuery UI widget *directly* by instanciating a widget 
         * for each object manually, adding it to the element data.
         */
        var widget = $.ui.autocomplete,
            fullname = 'ui-autocomplete',
            search_inst = $('#site-search-btn input[type=hidden][name=inst]').val(),
            options = {
                source: function(request, response) {
                    $.ajax({
                        url: "http://api.search.cam.ac.uk/suggest",
                        dataType: "jsonp",
                        data: { term: request.term, inst: search_inst },
                        success: response
                    })
                },
                select: function(event, ui) {
                    // Submit the form on select
                    $(this).val(ui.item.value);
                    $(this).context.form.submit();
                }
            };
        /* NB: Following jQuery selector matches mobile AND desktop views */
        $("input.search-autocomplete").each(function () {
            var instance = $.data(this, fullname, new widget(options, this));
        });
    </script>
		</div>

					<p class="campl-page-title">Department of History and Philosophy of Science</p>

			<div class="campl-column3 campl-spacing-column">

			<div class="campl-column9">
				<div class="campl-content-container">
					<h1 class="campl-sub-title">
                    Part-time PhD
                </h1>
				</div>
			</div>
		</div>
	</div><div class="campl-row campl-content campl-recessed-content">
			<div class="campl-wrap clearfix">
				<div class="campl-column3">
					
  <div class="campl-tertiary-navigation">
    <div class="campl-tertiary-navigation-structure">
      <ul class="campl-unstyled-list campl-vertical-breadcrumb"><li><a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk" title="Department of History and Philosophy of Science">
            Department of History and Philosophy of Science
            <span class="campl-vertical-breadcrumb-indicator"></span>
        </a></li>
        
          <li>
            <a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study" class="" title="Study HPS">
              Study HPS
              <span class="campl-vertical-breadcrumb-indicator"></span>
            </a>
          </li>
        
        
          <li>
            <a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/graduate" class="campl-parent-page" title="Graduate study">
              Graduate study
              <span class="campl-vertical-breadcrumb-indicator"></span>
            </a>
          </li>
        
      </ul><ul class="campl-unstyled-list campl-vertical-breadcrumb-navigation"><li class="navTreeItem visualNoMarker"><a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/graduate/why-cambridge"><span>Why study HPS at Cambridge?</span></a>
</li>
<li class="navTreeItem visualNoMarker navTreeFolderish"><a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/graduate/mphil-hpsm"><span>MPhil in History and Philosophy of Science and Medicine</span></a>
</li>
<li class="navTreeItem visualNoMarker"><a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/graduate/mphil-hms"><span>MPhil in Health, Medicine and Society</span></a>
</li>
<li class="navTreeItem visualNoMarker campl-selected navTreeFolderish"><a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/graduate/phd"><span>PhD in History and Philosophy of Science</span></a>
<ul class="campl-unstyled-list campl-vertical-breadcrumb-children navTree navTreeLevel1"><li class="navTreeItem visualNoMarker campl-selected"><a href="https://www.hps.cam.ac.uk/study/graduate/phd/part-time" class=" navTreeCurrentItem"><span>Part-time PhD</span></a>
</li>

</li>

  </div>

				</div>
				<div class="campl-column6  campl-main-content" id="campl-content"><div class="clearfix campl-carousel" id="campl-carousel">
        
      </div><div class="campl-content-container">

            <div id="viewlet-above-content">
</div>

            
                <div class="">

                    

                    

    <dl class="portalMessage info" id="kssPortalMessage" style="display:none"><dt>Info</dt>
        <dd></dd>
    </dl><div id="content">

                            

                            

                             <div id="viewlet-above-content-title">


</div>
                             
                                 
                                 
            
                
            
            
        
                             
                             <div id="viewlet-below-content-title">
</div>

                             
                                 
                                 
            
                
            
            
        
                             

                             <div id="viewlet-above-content-body">



</div>
                             <div id="content-core">
                                 
    
        
        <div class="" id="parent-fieldname-text-d13a21aa247643779533b4eb0f518b44">
            <p class="first">The PhD in History and Philosophy of Science is now offered as a part-time degree.</p>
<p>It is normally expected that applicants for the part-time PhD would be employed in a field related to HPS. Part-time students are also expected to play a full role in the life of the Department, for example via regular attendance at reading groups and seminars.</p>
<p>Most of the requirements for admission to part-time PhD studies, as well as regulations governing the degree, are the same as for the full-time PhD. Supervisors are appointed in the same way, and every part-time PhD student must be a member of a College.</p>
<p>However, there are a number of differences and special requirements.</p>
<h2>Entry requirements</h2>
<p>It is normally expected that part-time PhD applicants would have taken the Department's MPhil or Part III course and achieved a first class pass.</p>
<h2>Length of course</h2>
<p>For the part-time PhD the minimum research requirement is fifteen terms (i.e. five years). This is the total number of terms required to complete the PhD. Formal induction takes place in the first week of Michaelmas Term.</p>
<h2>Residence requirements</h2>
<p>There are no residence requirements for part-time degrees at Cambridge but there are minimum attendance requirements. The PhD is a part-time degree rather than a distance learning degree. Applicants are asked to confirm that these requirements do not conflict with their external commitments and that they will live close enough to Cambridge to make their participation in the course feasible. Overseas applicants need to provide evidence that they have received permission to remain in the UK for the minimum period required to complete the degree. The Board of Graduate Studies can advise on this and related matters.</p>
<h2>Fees</h2>
<p>The <strong>total</strong> University Composition Fee for the degree is the same, whether taken by the full-time or the part-time route. In practice, this normally means that 60% of the full-time fee is charged for each term of registration as a part-time student. College fees are charged on the same basis.</p>
<h2>Admission</h2>
<h3>Application procedure</h3>
<p>When completing the online application form, applicants should give their reasons for choosing part-time study.</p>
<p>All applicants for the part-time PhD must attend an admission interview. Applicants will be advised when, where and how this interview will be conducted once their application for admission has been assessed.</p>
<h3>Arrangements with employers</h3>
<p>Employed applicants should provide a letter from their employer stating that they will be allowed time off to attend the University, as required, for the whole duration of their course. If research for the degree is to be conducted in the workplace, applicants must agree this with their employer and provide evidence of this consent in their application. The Department will need to assure itself that the supervisor will be granted reasonable access to the workplace on request.</p>
<h3>Intellectual property rights</h3>
<p>Employed applicants should note that arrangements for intellectual property rights must be agreed in advance. Applicants must ensure that their employer reads this page as well as the information on the Board of Graduate Studies website relating to this issue.</p>
<p>If the employer is not asserting any rights in the intellectual property created in the course of the research, a statement to this effect must be provided in writing within the application. Generally, this is expected to be the case where the employer is neither paying for the time of study nor contributing to fees. In the absence of any claim on the intellectual property by the employer, the position on intellectual property is identical to that of a full-time PhD student. More information on this is available on the Board of Graduate Studies website.</p>
<p>If the employer is claiming rights in the intellectual property, the applicant and the employer must sign a short agreement which, among other things, confirms the level of any sponsorship by the employer and also sets out the position on intellectual property. This is administered through the University's <a class="external-link" href="http://www.research-operations.admin.cam.ac.uk/" target="_self" title="">Research Operations Office</a>. While the employer may wish to retain ownership in any intellectual property created by the student, the University will also want to ensure that regard is given to the intellectual property rights in any contributions from the supervisor or other members of the University, as well as its obligations to external sponsors. The University will also wish to make sure that the employer cannot restrict the use or exploitation of the student's share in any collaborative project in which the student takes part.</p>
<h3>Financial arrangements</h3>
<p>Candidates must produce a financial guarantee, or proof of means confirmed by a bank manager or other appropriate person, to cover at least the fees. The Board of Graduate Studies requires a guarantee based on capital for the fees element, but maintenance costs can be covered from various sources including income from the student's employment or from a partner. The Board of Graduate Studies does not usually entertain requests for assistance with maintenance in case of hardship.</p>
<p>Although the Arts and Humanities Research Council (AHRC) funds part-time students, part-time awards provide only 50% of the full-time rate of tuition fees. This may cause difficulties since the University charges part-time students 60% of the full-time rate.</p>
<h2>Progression from year to year</h2>
<h3>Annual progress paper</h3>
<p>At the end of <strong>each calendar year</strong> (both before and after registration), the student and supervisor are required to meet to consider a brief but formal progress paper prepared by the student.</p>
<h3>Registration</h3>
<p>The registration of part-time PhD students is the same as for full-time students except in the scheduling. Part-time students are required to undergo a registration exercise by the end of the fifth term if possible, and certainly by the end of the seventh term.</p>
<h2>Registration, residence and submission dates</h2>
<p>Registration and submission dates are based on the minimum research requirement of the PhD, which is three years of full-time research or five years of part-time research.</p>
<table class="data"><tbody><tr><th> </th><th>Term</th></tr><tr><td><strong>Minimum number of terms of research</strong></td>
<td>15</td>
</tr><tr><td><strong>Minimum number of terms of research in Cambridge</strong><br /> Leave to work away may be sought for the remainder. No more than the equivalent of ten part-time terms of leave to work away is permitted. Requests should be submitted in advance to the Degree Committee. Students are required to indicate whether the period of leave to work away is full-time or part-time.</td>
<td>5</td>
</tr><tr><td><strong>Submission of draft thesis to supervisor</strong><br /> All part-time students who have not submitted their thesis for examination already must by the end of the sixteenth term submit a complete draft to their supervisor. This requirement is monitored by the Degree Committee.</td>
<td>16</td>
</tr><tr><td><strong>Final submission deadline</strong><br /> Submission by last day of vacation following the term shown. Failure to meet this deadline results in automatic withdrawal from the Register of Graduate Students.</td>
<td>21</td>
</tr><tr><td><strong>Exemptions/allowances</strong><br /> The maximum number of terms for which exemptions or allowances are made following successful registration. Unlike terms of leave to work away, terms lost through intermission always count as part-time terms for part-time research students. Up to three terms of intermission at any one time may be requested, and not normally more than six terms in total throughout the whole PhD. The maximum time a part-time student may be on the Register of Graduate Students and still submit a thesis is ten years.</td>
<td>5</td>
</tr></tbody></table><h2>Early submission: exemption for a qualification already obtained</h2>
<p>Where exemption is sought for a previous qualification, the maximum number of terms for which exemption can be allowed is five terms, part-time, at the recommendation of the Degree Committee. Exemptions are normally applied for when a candidate is near completion and knows how many terms of research are required to complete the work. Early submission from part-time students who have no grounds for an exemption but who have been able to devote more time to their research than expected under the scheme is not permitted unless the full fee for the five-year minimum research period has been paid.</p>
<h2>Transfers between part-time status and full-time status</h2>
<p>Transfer of registration status is permitted once only in either direction (except in the case of applications for leave to work away) providing the student is still within the minimum research requirement. Transfers are not normally permitted after the end of the period for which the student is paying fees nor as a means of avoiding the original submission deadline. Transfer from full-time to part-time status is considered by the Degree Committee on a case-by-case basis and may be subject to the same restrictions as apply to entry to the part-time PhD.</p>
            
        </div>
    
    

                             </div>

        </div></div>
				<div class="campl-column3 campl-secondary-content">

<div class="portletWrapper" data-portlethash="706c6f6e652e7269676874636f6c756d6e0a636f6e746578740a2f4850534d41494e2f73747564792f67726164756174652f7068640a6d6f72652d616275742d7468652d706864" id="portletwrapper-706c6f6e652e7269676874636f6c756d6e0a636f6e746578740a2f4850534d41494e2f73747564792f67726164756174652f7068640a6d6f72652d616275742d7468652d706864"><div class="campl-content-container falcon-linkbox-portlet">
